item.title: Protecting information with Dynamic Access Control
item.description: Learn how to implement a secure remote access and user security solution which allows users in remote locations gain access to share folders which are protected with Dynamic Access Control and RMS classification. Featured: 1. Provision a computer for DirectAccess with offline Domain Join, 2. Connect via DA, 3. Create new DAC rules, 4. Create new RMS rules, 5. Auto-protect a document share with rules, and 6. User save a document in share, and have the document auto-protected.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to implement a secure remote access and user security solution which allows users in remote locations gain access to share folders which are protected with Dynamic Access Control and RMS classification. Featured: 1. Provision a computer for DirectAccess with offline Domain Join, 2. Connect via DA, 3. Create new DAC rules, 4. Create new RMS rules, 5. Auto-protect a document share with rules, and 6. User save a document in share, and have the document auto-protected.

item.title: Enabling Secure Remote Users with RemoteApp and VDI
item.description: Learn how to implement a secure remote access solution which allows users in remote locations to leverage RemoteApp and session-based VDI for Microsoft Office 2013. Featured: 1. Deploy Remote Desktop Services and publish RemoteApp and Session VDI, and 2. Launch remote applications.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to implement a secure remote access solution which allows users in remote locations to leverage RemoteApp and session-based VDI for Microsoft Office 2013. Featured: 1. Deploy Remote Desktop Services and publish RemoteApp and Session VDI, and 2. Launch remote applications.

item.title: DevOps: Global Service Monitoring
item.description: Global Service Monitor (GSM) provides the capability to monitor externally facing websites and web services from geo-distributed locations. System Center customers can configure monitoring scenarios, such as multistep web transactions, define precise criteria for success and instruct GSM to run those transactions periodically from 15 locations around the globe.
item.itunes:summary: Global Service Monitor (GSM) provides the capability to monitor externally facing websites and web services from geo-distributed locations. System Center customers can configure monitoring scenarios, such as multistep web transactions, define precise criteria for success and instruct GSM to run those transactions periodically from 15 locations around the globe.
item.dc:creator: Akin Olugbade, Laura Cruz

item.title: Why the Cloud is so Important for the SME
item.description: As a SME, getting the right support to your workforce can be a challenge, with Microsoft’s Cloud products like Office 365, Azure and CRM this challenge becomes an competitive advantage. Today’s given mobile work force needs to be in touch with the office as if it was there, the crazy thing is had anyone proposed this 5 years ago it would have been meet with a stern ‘No’ due to the costs but today this is completely the opposite and really easy to deploy.

item.title: Building Apps with the Kinect for Windows SDK
item.description: Kinect enables you to light up and truly re-imagine how users interact with applications. Come learn about the Kinect sensor capabilities including how to read raw data from the Kinect, including color, infrared, and depth data. Then we’ll build on this to show how to use skeletal tracking, face tracking, and new features from the 1.7 Kinect SDK that enables developers to easily add click, grab, and drag gestures. You’ll also see demos from some of the most common tools used for Kinect app development including the OpenCV vision library and the Kinect Service networking library that enables reading Kinect data via Windows Phone and Windows Store apps.

item.description: In this session, learn about the integration technologies from Microsoft (BizTalk, WF, Service Bus) and the core scenarios each technology targets, how they work together to address complex scenarios, and the future direction of the Microsoft Integration stack both on-premises and in the cloud.

item.title: Towards a Lightweight Integration Bus
item.description: We often see the term and architectural notion "ESB" showing up in customer engagements as well as RFPs. In some cases, we see them showing up in contexts where the goal is scale and availability on-premises as well as in the cloud. On the other hand, we've seen success with customers building their integration on top of a message bus where the integration workload happens at the end points, rather than inside a vendor ESB system. The goal of this talk is to highlight the paradox in using ESBs for large scale apps and to present an alternative in the form of a ‘Lightweight Integration Bus’ which is based on Windows Azure Service Bus.
item.itunes:summary: We often see the term and architectural notion "ESB" showing up in customer engagements as well as RFPs. In some cases, we see them showing up in contexts where the goal is scale and availability on-premises as well as in the cloud. On the other hand, we've seen success with customers building their integration on top of a message bus where the integration workload happens at the end points, rather than inside a vendor ESB system. The goal of this talk is to highlight the paradox in using ESBs for large scale apps and to present an alternative in the form of a ‘Lightweight Integration Bus’ which is based on Windows Azure Service Bus.
item.dc:creator: Ziv Rafalovich

item.title: System Management for Specific Applications: How Are Multiple Teams Working Together?
item.description: When it comes to specific applications, system management involves multiple teams that have to work together to run, maintain, and optimize their environment. Microsoft Exchange management and SharePoint management are two very good examples of this type of “Cross Team Management." Teams involved can be teams dedicated to using Microsoft SQL Server, System Center, Exchange, SharePoint, Active Directory, Windows servers, Mobile, etc. Each team brings their own structure, processes, and preferences. Come to this session and discuss the needs and constraints of your organization for better communication and processes to optimize the system management for critical applications.

item.description: We live in a user-centric world. Join this BOF to discuss how to best incorporate a smooth user experience in the enterprise. Explore an enterprise-scale user state virtualization solution that delivers a user’s personal Windows experience across multiple devices, showcasing simplicity in deployment and easy integration with other management tools.

item.title: How Far Can You Push Tabular?
item.description: Tabular is the new engine in Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services. It is an in-memory columnar database capable of unprecedented performance but… how far can we go with an in-memory database? Will you be able to load your data warehouse in-memory to obtain the best performance? What should you care about when building the DWH? What does “fast” mean? What about real-time data? Can you query many billions rows really fast? In this BOF we show some theory and share some of our experience, but we welcome your questions and experience, to build a round-table of experts in order to speak about this fascinating topic.

item.title: The Ever Expanding Roles and Responsibilities of an Exchange Administrator
item.description: Over the last five years, there has been a massive evolution in messaging and collaboration technologies. Messaging engineers are becoming increasingly responsible for not only email systems but mobile platforms and collaboration platforms as well. Much of this extra responsibility is self-inflicted as administrators are typically the grassroots innovators. What are teams doing to manage the never ending amount of user requests, performance issues, and service improvements? What can we do to set expectations and justify additional resources? How can we organize for success?

item.description: The Windows Phone 8 SDK includes the ability to install and launch apps on a device from within your app. This opens up the ability to create company hub apps that act as a central repository for your company's apps that can be installed without going thru the store. item.title: Is Creating a Multi-Platform/Multi-Device Application Truly a Challenge?
item.description: In today's marketplace, writing applications only for one type of device or platform may limit your business model. Writing for multiple devices on the same OS can be difficult enough let alone writing for multiple devices AND operating systems. Come discuss what the experience has been like for you and what challenges you faced and your successes. Discuss what may be preventing you from making the leap. What about tools? How are others doing service and data access? What about all the language choices? Join us for a lively discussion on this exciting topic.

We also discuss sharing code with other device ecosystems like iOS and Android. The discussion includes topics like advantages and disadvantages of shared UI code, different techniques for porting code, and language and platform pros and cons.

The majority of the session is an open-ended group discussion of our experiences with these two capable object-relational mapping technologies.

item.title: Dell Digital Wall Presentation
EMC Digital Wall Presentation
Building a Scalable, High Performance Microsoft Private Cloud Using HP Cloud Solutions for Microsoft
item.description: The HP Cloud Solution for Microsoft, most recently seen at the Microsoft Management Summit 2013 where it hosted the HOL Serverquarium, is the ideal infrastructure for virtualized workloads that will accelerate your journey to the Microsoft private cloud. Built on best-in-class HP Converged Infrastructure and Windows Server with Hyper-V and Systems Center 2012 SP1, we discuss: 1) How this solution was implemented at MMS 2013 and supported the creation and deployment of up to 8312 concurrent VMs across 30 HP BladeServers providing 277 VMs per server, 2) How management integrations enhance the capabilities of Microsoft System Center with server management, 3) How storage management integrations simplify the automated creation and management of LUNS on HP 3PAR storage using SMIS, System Center Virtual Machine Manager and Operations Manager, and 4) The implementation considerations, including design and integration points as well as options for support.
item.itunes:summary: The HP Cloud Solution for Microsoft, most recently seen at the Microsoft Management Summit 2013 where it hosted the HOL Serverquarium, is the ideal infrastructure for virtualized workloads that will accelerate your journey to the Microsoft private cloud. Built on best-in-class HP Converged Infrastructure and Windows Server with Hyper-V and Systems Center 2012 SP1, we discuss: 1) How this solution was implemented at MMS 2013 and supported the creation and deployment of up to 8312 concurrent VMs across 30 HP BladeServers providing 277 VMs per server, 2) How management integrations enhance the capabilities of Microsoft System Center with server management, 3) How storage management integrations simplify the automated creation and management of LUNS on HP 3PAR storage using SMIS, System Center Virtual Machine Manager and Operations Manager, and 4) The implementation considerations, including design and integration points as well as options for support.
item.dc:creator: Paul Gavin

item.title: LSI Digital Wall Presentation
NetApp Private Storage for Public Clouds
item.description: The concept of public clouds, with virtually unlimited scalability and elasticity is appealing to many customers. However, the loss of direct control of corporate data prevents many customers from taking the leap to pubic cloud. Learn about a novel approach that allows you to leverage the resources of public clouds while maintaining tight control of your corporate data. NetApp Private Storage for Public Clouds does just that.

item.title: Disruptive Innovations in Data Protection: Free Exchange and SharePoint Data Recovery
item.description: We all want to be able to recover objects from Microsoft Exchange and SharePoint databases faster and in a more efficient way. Join us for this short presentation on just how easy it is to recover Exchange and SharePoint items, located inside their respective agent-free image-based backup, using Veeam Explorer for Microsoft Exchange, and Veeam Explorer for Microsoft SharePoint. The tool is powerful, easy-to-use and FREE! When you see the demo, you’ll think its science fiction!

item.title: Hackers (Not) Halted (repeated from 6/5 at 5pm)
item.description: It is a hard time for penetration testers. Technologies are so advanced today, that we really need to struggle to do something malicious. We keep trying new tricks, and the system administrators keep adding new technologies to the field so that it is barely possible to fight against cryptography and new operating system security mechanisms. Fortunately for us, administrators are often very busy and security may not be their primary focus. Administrators' mistakes and people's misbehavior can be a great help to those who want access to a piece of information. During this session, learn the typical misconfiguration mistakes that can lead to some serious security issues and the same properly secured solutions and their reactions. If you care about security in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012, this session is for you!

item.title: Keynote Presentation
item.description: Despite sea changes in cloud computing, device proliferation, and the explosion of data, IT pros and developers still live for one simple thing: to deliver amazing experiences for their customers and end-users. In this keynote, Brad Anderson will unveil a broad set of new capabilities across the full suite of Microsoft Cloud OS products and technologies designed with that simple end goal in mind. Together with enterprise-optimized enhancements to the Windows 8 client, the advances that Brad will showcase in this keynote significantly advance Microsoft’s long-term effort to give you the most advanced and comprehensive set of services, products, and technologies in the industry. Learn how Windows 8 is ready for business, how Windows Azure is changing hybrid and private cloud computing, and how the world of modern application development is evolving. It’s time to embrace the challenges of a world full of risks and opportunities. See what Microsoft is delivering next, including new enterprise enhancements in the upcoming Windows 8.1 update, and learn what it means for your business as well as your career.

item.title: Women in Technology Luncheon: Managing Change and Transitions
item.description: Companies today must routinely change and adapt to maintain their competitive edge in an increasingly global economy. To stay competitive, they need to develop an agile workforce that is simply the best. Managing and dealing with change is a part of all of our personal and professional lives. How we navigate change determines success or failure—regardless if the change is our choice or not. Join a diverse panel discussion to hear insights and experiences on managing change and transitions.

item.title: Windows Server 2012 Desktop Virtualization (VDI) on Dell Active Infrastructure
item.description: Learn about the design and architecture decisions of a multi-thousand user Microsoft Server 2012 VDI/RDSH deployment as featured on the TechEd show floor. From Server, Storage, Networking down to the Client, this session provides an overview of the overall solution architecture based on Dell Active Infrastructure. Dell Active Infrastructure delivers modular and automated converged infrastructure solutions combining Servers, Storage, Networking, and Infrastructure Management into an integrated and optimized system for Microsoft Server 2012 Desktop Virtualization workloads. Also learn about the design decisions around CPU, Memory and Storage that led to the Reference Architecture. Highlights of this session include: 1) Deployment choices from Proof of Concept to large scale production: Dell’s 10 Seat Proof of Concept Solution to a “Datacenter in a Box” with Dell VRTX, 2) Architectural choices and decision points for a scalable, multi-thousand user Microsoft Desktop Virtualization deployment: “Why does the Reference Architecture look like this?”, 3) Storage sizing and guidance for various Desktop Virtualization workloads and user types: ”Let’s talk about IOPS”, 4) Impact of Virtualized Graphics with Hyper-V on the performance and sizing of Microsoft Server 2012 Desktop Virtualization: “Do GPU’s matter?”, and 5) Live demonstration of the management console and the Windows 8 VDI Remote FX experience “How do I manage this and what is the user experience like?”

Come learn some examples of how SMBs are able to move beyond just email and how they are integrating Office 365 into their business processes to gain productivity boosts and solve everyday problems such as scheduling, multiple offices/branches, outsourcing/contract work, and more.

item.description: In this session, discover how you can make Windows Azure YOUR datacenter. From compute and storage on demand to messaging and identity services. Come and see how you can power your enterprise today with Windows Azure.

item.title: Workloads: Monitoring the Microsoft Private Cloud Fabric with Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Operations Manager
item.description: This session covers best practices for monitoring fabric with System Center Operations Manager and Virtual Machine Manager. Operations Manager combined with Virtual Machine Manager provides best-in-class monitoring for your Microsoft Private Cloud. Come join us to learn how Operations Manager provides an all-up view of your entire environment and facilitates in-depth troubleshooting at the same time.

item.title: Understanding Hyper-V Replica: Performance, Networking and Automation
item.description: Hyper-V Replica has seen a lot of positive press and some early customer adoption case studies have been published. The level of interest from customers and the sophistication in the types of questions indicates that the usage is moving from "testing" to "deploy" and we are seeing the interest in deploying it for site-site DR as well as some hosting service providers using it to build their DR-As-A-Service offering. This session covers the types of deployment considerations such as performance, scale, networking when deploying Hyper-V Replica for Disaster Recovery Scenarios. We also demonstrate how an automated solution for disaster recovery can be developed with Hyper-V Replica and Microsoft System Center - Orchestrator.

item.dc:creator: Charles Joy, Raghavendran Gururajan

item.title: Understanding Dependency Injection and Those Pesky Containers
item.description: Dependency Injection is one of those terms that advanced programmers throw out with an expectation and assumption of full understanding on the part of the receiver. However, I constantly get asked by attendees, students, and clients to please recommend a good DI product and show them how to use it; and when I proceed to start talking about the subject, it becomes immediately apparent that many don't even know what they're asking about. It's easy to get infatuated by a cool buzz phrase, specially when you hear so many others using it. But to truly understand something you need to start by understanding the problem spaces that it is trying to solve. So let's bring you totally up to speed then. In this session, I explain dependency injection from concept to implementation, and use raw code samples to show you how it works and what problems it solves. Then I get into what a DI container is and some of the characteristics of the ones that are out there, including MEF. I finish by showing you implementation examples in three different platforms.

item.title: B2B Collaboration on Windows Azure
item.description: Windows Azure BizTalk Services provides a ready-to-go solution for Trading Partner Management and Business-to-Business Collaboration in the cloud. This session provides an overview of the B2B service. Learn how B2B on Azure creates a lower TCO option for enterprises using EDI and Value Added Networks.

item.title: ASP.NET Web API: Web Services for Websites, Modern Apps, and Mobile Apps
item.description: The new release of Web API offers some great new features while maintaining the original direction towards making REST and HTTP services easier in Microsoft .NET. Have you created a few websites that make use of AJAX calls to Web API controllers and wondered if there was a way to use the same sort of approach in a modern app or a mobile app? Have a client who needs a mobile app that’s supported in all the major smartphone platforms? Want to use Web API in a Single-Page Application (SPA)? Need to add authentication to your existing Web API? These and other topics are explored in this intermediate session on Web API, which covers a variety of ways it can be used to expose your application’s data through a universally-supported (or endlessly extensible) protocols.

item.title: Cloud-Powered Web Apps in Minutes with Windows Azure Mobile Services
item.description: Windows Azure Mobile Services makes it possible for you to add cloud-powered application logic, data and authentication to your apps in minutes. Whilst we've always made it easy to add these features to your Windows, iOS and Android applications, come along to this session to see how we've brought the same great capabilities and developer experience to web development. We'll cover the pros and cons of using a Cloud-based backend for your websites, so you can decide if this is right for your next project.

item.title: Partner Solutions for Modernizing Your .NET Applications
item.description: Usage of technology today is in the midst of a shift toward multi-screen device experiences powered by services in the cloud. The .NET Framework provides a first class development experience for the new needs applications, but moving your existing applications forward can be challenging. In this session you’ll learn some of the partner solutions available for helping you in that transformation, so you can embrace the emerging patterns that will shape the applications of the future. Mobilize, Xamarin and Citrix will show and demo their solutions to assist you in the process of modernizing your .NET applications for the new world of devices and services.

item.title: Windows in the Enterprise
item.description: This Foundational Session will focus on the latest enterprise capabilities and features of Windows to show you why Windows powers the best business tablets, how it empowers BYOD (bring your own device), makes your mobile users productive and connected, and enables you to create great business apps.
item.itunes:summary: This Foundational Session will focus on the latest enterprise capabilities and features of Windows to show you why Windows powers the best business tablets, how it empowers BYOD (bring your own device), makes your mobile users productive and connected, and enables you to create great business apps.

item.title: Transform the Datacenter with Server and Management Innovations from Microsoft
item.description: Cloud computing models are changing the technology landscape and providing more opportunity than ever for IT to deliver impact to the business. This Foundational Session will dive into the new Microsoft datacenter technologies and demonstrate how you can be the best provider of technology for your organization. Learn how Windows Server, System Center, Windows Azure, and other new technologies work together to help you provision and manage cloud and datacenter infrastructure, provide business continuity, deliver services, and manage applications. This includes breakthrough capabilities in the areas of storage, networking, virtualization, management, and automation. You will also learn how the latest innovations bring together on-premises approaches and cloud-based technologies to deliver hybrid cloud solutions leveraging your existing resources.

item.title: Modern Application Lifecycle Management
item.description: Delivering high-quality, modern applications requires modern application lifecycle management tools and processes. In this demo-packed session, you will learn about updates to Microsoft’s application lifecycle management offerings which will enable your software development teams to be more productive and to collaborate more effectively. Discover how your development team can collaborate more easily with stakeholders and operations teams and drive agility throughout your entire organization.

item.title: Microsoft Office & SharePoint 2013 Development: Introduction to the New Cloud App Model
item.description: With Office and SharePoint 2013, we introduced a new unified cloud app model based on web standards, providing a consistent way to rapidly build and deploy apps that integrate with the tools and web hosting platforms you are most familiar and comfortable with. In this session, you will learn about the ways in which you can enhance Office and SharePoint with light touch, robust web solutions, deploy apps into Office and SharePoint for easy discovery and sharing, and manage the portfolio of app investments you’ve made across your enterprise.

item.title: Enabling People-Centric IT
item.description: The rapid growth in use of smart devices combined with ubiquitous access to cloud services online is changing the way that people use their personal technology to get work done. The Consumerization of IT mega-trend brings with it a rich set of opportunities for organizations, as well as challenges to protect corporate information and other assets. In this foundational session learn how Microsoft’s approach to delivering people-centric IT is helping customers enable users to work on devices of their choosing with consistent experiences, and providing IT a unified infrastructure for managing and delivering applications and other resources, all while helping organizations protect what is important to them. See how innovations in Windows Server, System Center, and Windows Intune are providing IT with the necessary capabilities to enable people-centric IT.

item.title: Building Modern Business Applications
item.description: A revolution is taking place—it's impacting the speed at which applications need to be built, and the jaw dropping capabilities they need to deliver. Modern business applications contextualize data from many sources, span multiple devices, are rapidly built and deployed, receive constant updates, and are always available. Come see how to take advantage of a breadth of application development technologies including Visual Studio, .NET, SQL and Windows Azure to deliver your next great modern business application.

item.title: Big Data. Small Data. All Data.
item.description: Attend this session and dive into the buzz around Big Data, business analytics, and In-memory technologies—the new frontier for the data platform. Learn about unlocking insights on any data, big or small, via new tools which streamline finding and combining all types of data, powerful tools to analyze and refine insights, and a complete data platform for IT to operationalize processes and learnings. Also, learn how SQL Server In-memory technology will light up the new data platform frontier with blazing-fast performance across analytics, data warehousing querying, and transaction processing all backed by a platform that offers flexibility and choice across on-premises and cloud.

item.title: Deliver IT Agility in the Modern Datacenter with Integration of Virtualization, Cloud, and Application Infrastructure
item.description: A modern datacenter needs to provide application and services delivery with non-disruptive operations, proven efficiency, and seamless scalability. With Windows Server 2012 SMB 3.0, ODX, Microsoft Hyper-V and Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1, a modern datacenter can virtualize with much greater business value, performance, and efficiency, and also deliver private cloud capabilities with easy-to-use provisioning, automation and self-service. Application and infrastructure upgrades can be complex, but integration of these technologies can lead to cost savings of 50% or more. Learn how to deliver IT agility in the modern datacenter with integration of virtualization, private cloud, and application infrastructure.

item.title: Using Dynamic Access Control and Rights Management for Information Protection
item.description: You’ve heard about DAC, but wondered exactly what it is and how it works? Heard the term claims-based access but not sure what that means? In this demo-oriented session we answer these questions and more! Windows Server 2012 provides an incredibly powerful information protection solution for users and devices. Come along and see how you can leverage it!

item.title: Agile Testing Across Browsers and Across Devices
item.description: In a world where consumers and even business users are increasingly bringing their own devices to consume the applications you build, it’s essential to ensure that the applications you create perform as expected from a variety of client experiences. In this session, learn how you can use tools and techniques from Microsoft and partners to effectively test your applications from a variety of clients. We explore how Visual Studio allows you to author automated tests which can be reused and played back across a variety of web browsers. Also, see a solution for testing your applications across a wide range of devices and form factors.

item.description: Microsoft “Data Explorer” for Excel is a new set of experiences to empower business analysts and end users to discover, acquire, and transform data of any shape and size. Come learn more about how to reduce your overall time to insight with this fresh and innovative approach for querying and mashing up data in Excel and PowerPivot, for your Self-Service BI needs.

item.title: Modernizing WPF Line-of-Business Applications
item.description: Desktop Applications running on Windows play a critical role in many organizations and therefore have an important role to play as businesses move towards modern, dynamic, flexible applications and embrace a devices/services paradigm. This session shows WPF developers how to take advantage of Microsoft’s newest Frameworks and technologies in their line-of-business applications. In this session we cover topics such as taking advantage of Microsoft .NET 4.5 framework features, accessing OData and HTTP services, cloud-enabling applications to take full advantage of Windows Azure, making Desktop Applications more touch friendly, sharing code with other projects such as Windows Store or Windows Phone apps, and some best practices around app architecture.

item.title: Lap Around Monitoring, Management and DevOps Solutions in Windows Azure
item.description: Windows Azure has made a great deal of improvements in the area of management and monitoring of cloud applications since the first release early last year. In this session, you will get a preview of the exciting, new monitoring and management capabilities that gives you insights into your running application and troubleshooting your applications end-to-end across all Azure workloads. Learn about the new management capabilities for Virtual Machines, Virtual Networks, Service Bus, SQL Azure and your other business critical workloads running on Windows Azure
item.itunes:summary: Windows Azure has made a great deal of improvements in the area of management and monitoring of cloud applications since the first release early last year. In this session, you will get a preview of the exciting, new monitoring and management capabilities that gives you insights into your running application and troubleshooting your applications end-to-end across all Azure workloads. Learn about the new management capabilities for Virtual Machines, Virtual Networks, Service Bus, SQL Azure and your other business critical workloads running on Windows Azure
item.dc:creator: Karandeep Anand, Shankarnarayan Chandrika

item.title: TechEd 101 - An Introduction to TechEd (repeat)
item.description: Join this overview of TechEd where the major components of the event are explained and you learn how to take advantage of all that is offered. Whether it is your first time at TechEd or you are a conference veteran, there’s always something to learn that will make your time at TechEd more valuable.

item.title: The Right Project Management Solution: From Microsoft SharePoint Online to Project Online
item.description: When it comes to project management, every individual, team, and organization has unique needs. Microsoft's vision for project management is to enable individuals and teams to choose the tool that is the best fit for their specific project while still delivering the visibility that their organization needs to ensure focus on the right priorities. This session helps you understand how all the solutions across Microsoft Office 365, SharePoint, and Project fit together so you can chart a realistic approach to project management for your organization that will deliver immediate value with an eye to the future.

item.title: Microsoft Office 365 Directory and Access Management with Windows Azure Active Directory
item.description: You’ve invested time and money in your on-premises directory infrastructure, and now you want to leverage that investment to manage your Office 365 subscription in the cloud. This session dives deep into the various options available for connecting your on-premises directory with Windows Azure Active Directory. We cover topics ranging from provisioning and directory synchronization to the technologies we offer for user Identity and Access Management. Topics include integrating WS-* partners with the Works with Office 365 program, and new synchronization mechanisms with the Directory Sync tool.

item.title: Understanding Immersive Productivity and Collaboration Experiences with Perceptive Pixel Devices
item.description: You've seen the devices - in the news, at Microsoft Technology Centers, on Channel 9 and in use by television personalities including John King and Dr. Phil. Come learn more about the technology that drives these incredible devices. From hardware nuances like parallax and optical bonding to why these technical features are important to businesses of all sizes. Over the course of 75 minutes we introduce you to Perceptive Pixel hardware and what makes them unique game-changers in opening new spaces and use cases for productivity and collaboration experiences within Microsoft Office and Lync.

item.title: Shouldn’t All of Your Storage Be Highly Available?
item.description: What is blocking that as a reality for your business? Is it Cost? Complexity? Lack of storage choices? Today’s reality is that business uptime is more critical than ever. It translates directly to business viability and profitability. However, we also know that businesses of all sizes are facing the double challenge of explosive data growth and IT budget pressure. So, how do businesses achieve the goal of high availability in a simple, cost-effective way? Mr. Greg Huff, LSI CTO, discusses how the industry is looking at evolving DAS storage, making it sharable and scalable. He discusses how a new LSI storage architecture, combined with Microsoft’s Windows 2012 Continuous Availability Initiative, will enable business benefits including uptime, ease-of-use, and reduced TCO. Session attendees will learn from a technologist's viewpoint, the significance of this new technology, how it works, and how they can get started applying it to their businesses.

item.title: Practical Implementation of Windows Server 2012 Storage Technologies
item.description: Learn best practices and demonstrations discussing new features in Windows Server 2012 such as Offloaded Data Transfer (ODX), SMB 3.0, and Thin Provisioning including practical implementation when using these features to improve performance and manageability in the Data Center. Microsoft System Center Operations Manager, Virtual Machine Manager and Orchestrator are also discussed to show how to build and deploy an automated private cloud using Windows Server 2012, technologies such as virtual HBAs and using snapshot technology to rapidly deploy Hyper-V based virtual machines. Proven solutions with performance data, application workloads and real-life scenarios are also covered.

item.title: Microsoft Private Cloud Fast Track v3: Private Cloud Reference Architecture Based on Windows Server 2012 and Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1
item.description: Microsoft Private Cloud Fast Track delivers the fastest path to Private Cloud, allowing the purchase of complete cloud solutions from our hardware partners with the confidence that they have been pre-validated and tested against Microsoft design principles. Join us for this session where we will dive into the reference architecture and design principles for compute, network, storage, and management components of private cloud solutions. We will discuss what’s new in v3 of the Fast Track program, based on Windows Server 2012 and System Center 2012 SP1, including the program’s expansion to include different architectural scale points to address varying customer and market segments. Come learn about the new Fast Track Solutions offered by our hardware partners to discover which solutions best suit your needs and the tools available to make migrations easy!

item.dc:creator: Jeff Woolsey, Lavanya Krishnan

item.title: Microsoft System Center Data Protection Manager and Veeam: Better Together
item.description: Having a complete backup strategy is critical. Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery are still two words that should be in every IT infrastructure strategy, but how can you make sure that you have a reliable, inexpensive, fast solution for your private cloud? In this conceptual session, learn that Veeam Backup & Replication combined with System Center Data Protection Manager can deliver a cost-effective, easy-to-manage solution to delivering a complete backup and recovery strategy. We share best practices and show you how you can easily recover - no matter what happens.

item.dc:creator: Mike Resseler, Doug Hazelman

item.title: Any Data, Any Size: Architecting Breakthrough Performance with Mission Critical Solutions Built on HP AppSystem for Parallel Data Warehouse
item.description: With the advent of in-memory technologies such as xVelocity (an in-memory columnar store index), Polybase (Hadoop integration) and SMP and MPP architectural options (scaling to multiple PB for data warehousing), Microsoft SQL Server 2012 provides levels of scalability and performance to handle true enterprise-level, mission critical data management needs. This session provides an in-depth look at the HP reference architectures and appliances built on SQL Server 2012 and SQL Server Parallel Data Warehouse. The session further explores the HP AppSystem for PDW, including details on the HP Support Pack Utility Suite (e.g.: enabling thousands of driver/firmware updates with a single click), and PDW architectural elements which enable 100x query performance improvements, scalability from ¼ rack to 5PB, as well as providing an ideal platform for integrating Hadoop into an organization’s structured data management infrastructure.

item.dc:creator: Jeff Spiller

item.title: Predictive Analytics with Microsoft Big Data
item.description: Predictive Analytics is one of the big customer requirements and an emerging trend for big data. Microsoft big data solution and data mining algorithms offer great tools you can use to mine all kinds of structured or unstructured data. We show how to do predictive analytics using structured and unstructured data with Microsoft big data solution and data mining algorithms. Starting with basics of data mining, we show how to build great models including customer segmentation (to understand your customers), prediction models (to find the right target customers for appropriate products), recommendation engine (to upsell and cross-sell), etc. We start with a realistic and simple scenario and demo the whole process from scratch using tools including the Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Data Mining Add-in for Excel, SQL Server Analysis Services, Microsoft HDInsight (Big Data) Solution, etc. We also share lessons learned and the pitfalls to avoid during predictive analytics process.

item.title: Exam Prep: 70-467: MCSE: Business Intelligence: SQL Server
item.description: This Exam Prep session focuses on what you need to know to get certified and pass the SQL Server 2012 Microsoft Certified Professional exam 70-467 (Designing Business Intelligence Solutions with Microsoft SQL Server 2012). The session is led by an expert Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT) who regularly presents on this topic. The presenter walks you through the objectives that are covered in the exam, and gives you some general exam taking tips and technology “gotchas” about SQL Server 2012. Attendees will leave with an understanding of how Microsoft certification works, what are the key topics covered in the exams, and an exhaustive look at resources for getting ready for the exam. The session is led by a Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT), experienced in delivering sessions on these topics.
item.dc:creator: Gary Grudzinskas

These exams are required for the new MCSA: Windows Server 2012 certification. The session is led by a Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT), experienced in delivering sessions on these topics.

item.title: Microsoft ASP.NET, Web, and Cloud Tools Preview
item.description: One ASP.NET and Visual Studio 2012.2 includes some amazing new tooling enhancements for HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript. We're marching forward with even more great stuff. There’s powerful features like Model Binding + Friendly URLs. ASP.NET Web Forms allows you to build an application with all the bells and whistles of an MVC 4 application with all the productivity of Web Forms. ASP.NET Web Forms are also “DRYer” than ever with Models + Model Validation + Model Binding + Clean URLs + Mobile support. ASP.NET Web Pages along with ASP.NET Web API plus HTML5, JavaScript and modern development techniques makes development fun again. Join Damian as he shows you how it works together and where we're going tomorrow!

item.title: Running BI Workloads on Windows Azure Virtual Machines
item.dc:creator: Chuck Heinzelman

item.title: New Architecture for the New World with Citrix XenDesktop on Microsoft Hyper-V Server 2012
item.description: Learning the latest architecture ahead of time is a massive time saver for any virtual Desktops n Apps enterprise or cloud architect. What can I expect for scalability and how should I build it? What tips and tricks can a software vendor share with me to make my job easier? In this session, learn new methods in deploying XenDesktop with Hyper-V 2012 with System Center 2012 SP1 and how to apply them in the real world. There are plenty of technical demonstrations and one lucky winner will also walk away with a Samsung SSD, so don’t miss this session!
item.itunes:summary: Learning the latest architecture ahead of time is a massive time saver for any virtual Desktops n Apps enterprise or cloud architect. What can I expect for scalability and how should I build it? What tips and tricks can a software vendor share with me to make my job easier? item.dc:creator: Tony Sanchez

item.title: Testing and Debugging Microsoft SharePoint Applications with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012
item.description: Visual Studio 2012 updates 1 and 2 have introduced a host of new capabilities to make it easier to test and debug SharePoint 2010 and SharePoint 2013 applications. In this demo-packed session, see how you can write unit tests for SharePoint which can run with the aid of SharePoint Emulators, without requiring a physical SharePoint deployment. Learn how to author coded UI tests which allow you to script tests which simulate users interacting with your SharePoint applications. Learn how you can compose web performance tests into load tests which can be used to test the performance and scalability of your SharePoint applications. Finally, see how IntelliTrace can be used to go deep into the SharePoint stack and understand exactly what’s happening when things go wrong.

item.dc:creator: Brian Randell, Benjamin Day

item.title: Taking Application Lifecycle Management to the Cloud with the Team Foundation Service
item.description: The Team Foundation Service at tfs.visualstudio.com brings together Microsoft Visual Studio, Team Foundation Server, and Windows Azure and now it's time to find out how to get started. In this session we begin by demonstrating creating an account, setting up team projects, tracking issues and working on a website project. We also discuss how Team Foundation Service differs from Team Foundation Server and what that means to you.
item.itunes:summary: The Team Foundation Service at tfs.visualstudio.com brings together Microsoft Visual Studio, Team Foundation Server, and Windows Azure and now it's time to find out how to get started. In this session we begin by demonstrating creating an account, setting up team projects, tracking issues and working on a website project. We also discuss how Team Foundation Service differs from Team Foundation Server and what that means to you.
item.dc:creator: Dmitry Lyalin

item.title: Windows 8 Security Internals
item.description: Windows 8 extends the security and isolation capabilities of Windows to help build a far more trusted application experience. In this session, get a review of the Windows features that have been evolving since Windows Vista, and culminating in a whole new level of application isolation in Windows 8 Applications.
item.itunes:summary: Windows 8 extends the security and isolation capabilities of Windows to help build a far more trusted application experience. In this session, get a review of the Windows features that have been evolving since Windows Vista, and culminating in a whole new level of application isolation in Windows 8 Applications.
item.dc:creator: Chris Jackson

item.title: Microsoft SharePoint 2013 Administration
item.description: In this session we cover what's new in SharePoint 2013. First, we cover installing SharePoint 2013 and configuring your new farm. This session provides what you need to start planning your new SharePoint 2013 farm and dovetails nicely into Part 2, which covers changes in SharePoint 2013 the SharePoint administrator should know about. We cover changes to how you’ll plan your farm topology. We also cover the changes to the Search service application and how that impacts scale. Finally, we spend some time talking about everyone’s favorite part of SharePoint Server, the User Profile Service.

item.dc:creator: Todd Klindt, Shane Young

item.title: Introduction to Coded UI Tests with Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012
item.description: Coded UI tests provide a way to create fully automated tests to validate the functionality and behavior of your application’s user interface. In this lab, gain a basic understanding of coded UI tests by creating a new test and adding validation logic to it.
item.itunes:summary: Coded UI tests provide a way to create fully automated tests to validate the functionality and behavior of your application’s user interface. In this lab, gain a basic understanding of coded UI tests by creating a new test and adding validation logic to it.

item.title: Authoring and Running Manual Tests Using Microsoft Test Manager 2012
item.description: In this lab, learn how to use Microsoft Test Manager 2012 to author a manual test case and take advantage of test parameters. Then run this test case using the Microsoft Test Runner. While running this test case, capture an action recording which can be used to take advantage of Fast Forward for Manual Testing, to quickly re-run test steps or even entire test cases in the future. Finally, explore how Shared Steps can be used to more effectively author common test steps, which can then be reused across multiple test cases.

item.dc:creator: Brian Keller

item.title: Testing and Debugging Microsoft SharePoint 2010 Applications with Visual Studio 2012
item.description: In this lab, learn about new features provided in Update 1 that make testing and debugging SharePoint 2010 applications easier, thereby helping to improve the quality and scalability of your product.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, learn about new features provided in Update 1 that make testing and debugging SharePoint 2010 applications easier, thereby helping to improve the quality and scalability of your product.

item.title: Introduction to PreEmptive Analytics
item.description: PreEmptive Analytics Community Edition for Team Foundation Server is a third-party tool created by PreEmptive which allows you to gain insight into errors experienced by your customers. By instrumenting your application for analytics, you’ll be able to see these exceptions in Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012 so you can easily triage them right alongside your bugs. Exceptions are analyzed, correlated, and distilled into a set of “production incidents” based on the rules and operational thresholds you specify.
item.itunes:summary: PreEmptive Analytics Community Edition for Team Foundation Server is a third-party tool created by PreEmptive which allows you to gain insight into errors experienced by your customers. By instrumenting your application for analytics, you’ll be able to see these exceptions in Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012 so you can easily triage them right alongside your bugs. Exceptions are analyzed, correlated, and distilled into a set of “production incidents” based on the rules and operational thresholds you specify.

item.title: Exploratory Testing and Other Enhancements in Microsoft Test Manager 2012
item.description: In this lab, learn about some of the improvements in Microsoft Test Manager 2012. Learn about how exploratory testing (also called XT, or agile testing) has become a first-class experience in the toolset. This allows a tester to more flexibly test the underlying software without relying solely on formal test cases. Meanwhile, Microsoft Test Manager will continue to capture rich diagnostics about the application being tested which can be delivered to the development team if a bug is discovered. You also learn about some of the other fit-and-finish features in Microsoft Test Manager, such as the ability to use rich text when authoring test cases.

You also learn about some of the other fit-and-finish features in Microsoft Test Manager, such as the ability to use rich text when authoring test cases.

item.title: Making Developers More Productive with Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012
item.description: This lab is all about those “fit-and-finish” scenarios in Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012 which will make developers more productive as they write code and collaborate with other team members. Learn about the new integrated code reviews; the new “My Work” experience for managing your active tasks; and once you’re “in the zone” Visual Studio will now help you stay focused on the task at hand, no matter how much you’re randomized, with a new suspend/resume experience. Also, learn how to work offline seamlessly, how the new merging experience works, and how you can more easily find work items.

Learn about the new integrated code reviews; the new “My Work” experience for managing your active tasks; and once you’re “in the zone” Visual Studio will now help you stay focused on the task at hand, no matter how much you’re randomized, with a new suspend/resume experience. Also, learn how to work offline seamlessly, how the new merging experience works, and how you can more easily find work items.

item.title: Unit Testing, Code Coverage, and Code Clone Analysis with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012
item.description: IntelliTrace – first released in Visual Studio 2010 – changed the game for debugging by allowing developers to step “back in time” to see how an application got into its current state. By exposing events such as file and registry access, exceptions, and method calls, an IntelliTrace file can provide a detailed view into application behavior. In this lab, learn how Visual Studio 2012 will extend the capabilities of IntelliTrace beyond the development and testing organizations by providing IT administrators with the ability to capture IntelliTrace files running from production servers. These files can then be analyzed by developers to help diagnose production issues.

By exposing events such as file and registry access, exceptions, and method calls, an IntelliTrace file can provide a detailed view into application behavior. item.title: Building the Right Software: Generating Storyboards and Collecting Stakeholder Feedback with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012
item.description: How often have you built the software that your users asked for, but not necessarily what they wanted? In a world of increasingly complex software projects, it is critical that we can accurately capture requirements from users, which can then be translated into working software. In this lab, learn how new capabilities of Visual Studio 2012 will make it possible to both rapidly storyboard your requirements, and – as your software evolves – get rich, actionable feedback from users of your software which can help shape what you deliver.
item.itunes:summary: How often have you built the software that your users asked for, but not necessarily what they wanted? In a world of increasingly complex software projects, it is critical that we can accurately capture requirements from users, which can then be translated into working software. In this lab, learn how new capabilities of Visual Studio 2012 will make it possible to both rapidly storyboard your requirements, and – as your software evolves – get rich, actionable feedback from users of your software which can help shape what you deliver.

item.title: Agile Project Management in Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012
item.description: In this lab, learn how Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012 can help you quickly plan, manage, and track work across your entire team. Explore the new product backlog, sprint backlog, and task boards which can be used to track the flow of work during the course of an iteration.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, learn how Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012 can help you quickly plan, manage, and track work across your entire team. Explore the new product backlog, sprint backlog, and task boards which can be used to track the flow of work during the course of an iteration.

item.title: Integrating Development and Operations with Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012 and System Center 2012 - Operations Manager
item.description: In this lab, learn about how communications and workflow between operations and development teams can be improved by utilizing Microsoft System Center 2012 - Operations Manager, Team Foundation Server 2012, and Visual Studio Ultimate 2012. As you walk through the exercises, see how Operations Manager can monitor a sample ASP.NET website, synchronize select operational alerts with Team Foundation Server, and automate the collection and delivery of IntelliTrace logs to the development team.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, learn about how communications and workflow between operations and development teams can be improved by utilizing Microsoft System Center 2012 - Operations Manager, Team Foundation Server 2012, and Visual Studio Ultimate 2012. As you walk through the exercises, see how Operations Manager can monitor a sample ASP.NET website, synchronize select operational alerts with Team Foundation Server, and automate the collection and delivery of IntelliTrace logs to the development team.

item.title: Managing Requirements and User Expectations in Agile Projects
item.description: The only way to avoid requirements churn is to deliver requirements faster that your customers can change their minds. But Forrester has characterized most large software projects as “Water-Scrum-Fall,” meaning that today’s companies are good at coding incrementally, but this greatness is sandwiched between the waterfalls of Requirements and Operations. So, even when the development team can move fast, the rest of the organization can’t. It doesn’t have to be this way. By focusing on the two ends, teams can dramatically speed software delivery. This session focuses on the front end: working closely with stakeholders to rapidly identify, elicit and scope requirements, all while getting very rapid feedback throughout the entire process. Today’s powerful tools and techniques are bringing requirements work closer to development teams, providing spectacular improvements in delivery speed. This demo-heavy session covers the tools and techniques necessary to continuously deliver requirements. See real tools in action, such as UserVoice, inteGREAT, and the PowerPoint Storyboarding and Feedback Client tools which were both released as part of Visual Studio 2012. Additionally, throughout the presentation and demos, we’ll be tying the tool usage to the right processes to enable continuous delivery. Continuous delivery demands a great deal from your people, processes and tools. This session will help get you there.

item.title: DevOps: Increasing Application Lifecycle Efficiencies with Microsoft Visual Studio and System Center
item.description: Building, delivering and operating software is not a trivial task. Why should you care about integrating these two functions? In this session we dig into best practices and show you how you can use familiar tools like Microsoft Visual Studio 2012, Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012, and Microsoft System Center to increase the efficiency of deploying and maintaining your applications.
item.itunes:summary: Building, delivering and operating software is not a trivial task. Why should you care about integrating these two functions? In this session we dig into best practices and show you how you can use familiar tools like Microsoft Visual Studio 2012, Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2012, and Microsoft System Center to increase the efficiency of deploying and maintaining your applications.
item.dc:creator: Larry Guger, Charlie Satterfield

item.title: Agile Software Development with Microsoft Visual Studio ALM
item.description: Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server provide a powerful and flexible toolset to help you practice agile software development. But did you know that Microsoft themselves “dogfood” their own tools during the process of planning, developing, and testing Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server? In this session you will learn strategies for successfully practicing agile software development from two senior members of Microsoft’s developer division.
item.itunes:summary: Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server provide a powerful and flexible toolset to help you practice agile software development. But did you know that Microsoft themselves “dogfood” their own tools during the process of planning, developing, and testing Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server? In this session you will learn strategies for successfully practicing agile software development from two senior members of Microsoft’s developer division.
item.dc:creator: Peter Provost, Aaron Bjork

item.title: HDInsight: Introduction to Hadoop on Windows
item.description: Apache Hadoop is open source software that was born out of the large web properties need to process massive amounts of data. Now Hadoop is becoming the defacto platform for big data storage and processing in the enterprise. A modern Hadoop-based data platform is a combination of multiple open source projects brought together tested and integrated to create an enterprise-grade platform. In this session we review the Hadoop projects required in a Windows Hadoop platform and how it integrates with Microsoft SQL Server Database Platform analysis tools. We drill down into Hadoop integration and implementation Windows, Windows Azure and integration with the SQL Server Data Platform.

We drill down into Hadoop integration and implementation Windows, Windows Azure and integration with the SQL Server Data Platform.
item.dc:creator: Rohit Bakhshi

item.title: Porting Windows 8 to Windows Phone 8
item.description: In this lab, we take a full Windows 8 application and walk through all of the steps necessary to bring it to Windows Phone 8.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, we take a full Windows 8 application and walk through all of the steps necessary to bring it to Windows Phone 8.

item.title: Windows Phone 8: Wallet
item.description: Windows Phone 8 has a new feature called ‘Wallet' which provides third-party applications that are about finance, loyalty programs, or end user deals. The Wallet is a new way in which we bring user scenarios together in a meaningful way, and provide application developers more ways to expose their apps in contextually relevant ways. This lab walks you through building a Wallet app.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Phone 8 has a new feature called ‘Wallet' which provides third-party applications that are about finance, loyalty programs, or end user deals. The Wallet is a new way in which we bring user scenarios together in a meaningful way, and provide application developers more ways to expose their apps in contextually relevant ways. This lab walks you through building a Wallet app.

item.title: Windows Phone 8: Voice Command
item.description: In this lab, we walk you through using the Speech API directly in your own application.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, we walk you through using the Speech API directly in your own application.

item.title: Windows Phone 8: Tiles
item.description: Tiles are one of the most interesting aspects of Windows Phone; the ability for your application to dynamically drive and update information directly for the user. In Windows Phone 8 we make new tile sizes available to you, and we make it easier than ever to leverage several of the tile ‘templates' that are used by many of the built-in experiences in Windows Phone, so that your application can look more like a built-in part of the operating system. In this lab, we show you how use those new features.
item.itunes:summary: Tiles are one of the most interesting aspects of Windows Phone; the ability for your application to dynamically drive and update information directly for the user. In Windows Phone 8 we make new tile sizes available to you, and we make it easier than ever to leverage several of the tile ‘templates' that are used by many of the built-in experiences in Windows Phone, so that your application can look more like a built-in part of the operating system. In this lab, we show you how use those new features.

item.title: Windows Phone 8: Running Tracker
item.description: Windows Phone 8 introduces a powerful new Map control powered by data from the Nokia Maps service. This lab walks you through the new features of the map control in the context of a popular scenario: the running app.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Phone 8 introduces a powerful new Map control powered by data from the Nokia Maps service. This lab walks you through the new features of the map control in the context of a popular scenario: the running app.

item.title: Windows Phone 8: Purchase
item.description: Windows Phone 8 adds the ability for developers to create and sell additional components of their application after the user has already installed. This opens up radically popular new scenarios for monetizing your app. This lab walks you through the steps required to leverage this feature, and delivers important information on how to build and test the feature.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Phone 8 adds the ability for developers to create and sell additional components of their application after the user has already installed. This opens up radically popular new scenarios for monetizing your app. This lab walks you through the steps required to leverage this feature, and delivers important information on how to build and test the feature.

item.title: Windows Phone 8: Lock Screen Wallpaper
item.description: In Windows Phone 8, your application can register itself as a wallpaper provider; this functionality allows the end user to select your application as the source for periodic programmatic updates to the lock screen wallpaper, (as well as custom notification area notifications).
item.itunes:summary: In Windows Phone 8, your application can register itself as a wallpaper provider; this functionality allows the end user to select your application as the source for periodic programmatic updates to the lock screen wallpaper, (as well as custom notification area notifications).

item.title: Windows Phone 8: File and Protocol Association
item.description: Windows Phone 8 enables your application to register itself as a protocol handler, which in turn allows other applications to call your app and pass it parameters. In this lab we walk through the steps to execute on this.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Phone 8 enables your application to register itself as a protocol handler, which in turn allows other applications to call your app and pass it parameters. In this lab we walk through the steps to execute on this.

item.title: The Windows Phone 8 Networking Survival Kit
item.description: Take a lightning tour of the many Windows Phone 8 connectivity options for developers. There are more than ever before: HTTP networking APIs, NFC and Bluetooth including ‘tap to connect’ with Windows 8 slates, WCF and OData services, are just the tip of the iceberg. See how to program with the new DataSense feature. Store data in Sky Drive. Share state between Windows Phone 8 app and the Windows 8 version of your app. See some real practical demos, such as how to connect the Windows Phone 8 emulator to services running on your development PC, how to implement compression with HTTP networking and how you can handle credentials when accessing services that require user authentication.
item.itunes:summary: Take a lightning tour of the many Windows Phone 8 connectivity options for developers. There are more than ever before: HTTP networking APIs, NFC and Bluetooth including ‘tap to connect’ with Windows 8 slates, WCF and OData services, are just the tip of the iceberg. See how to program with the new DataSense feature. Store data in Sky Drive. item.title: Using C and C++ in Your Windows Phone 8 Applications
item.description: Want to develop Windows Phone 8 applications with a number of different programming languages and different API’s? We want to give you the flexibility to develop applications with both managed as well as native code. Use C++ inside your own app after this session. Benefit from using C++ for Windows Phone 8 app development in many other scenarios too.

item.title: Creating Windows Phone 8 Apps for Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: This session covers the tools, techniques, and best practices for building great Windows Phone apps that interact with SharePoint Server 2013.
item.itunes:summary: This session covers the tools, techniques, and best practices for building great Windows Phone apps that interact with SharePoint Server 2013.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Thake

item.title: Support Your Demanding LOB Apps With SQLite and Windows Phone 8
item.description: Most mobile apps require the ability to store data locally on a device to deal with the realities of a disconnected world where a ubiquitous wireless data network is nonexistent. While many consumer apps can save light amounts of data as small files, the data requirements of mobile line of business apps is much greater. With Windows Phone 8, Microsoft includes support for the embedded database, SQLite. Join Andy as he walks you through creating local databases and tables and show you how to work with offline data.

item.title: Developing Large-Scale Enterprise Mobile Apps for Windows Phone 8 and Windows Tablets
item.description: Building a Mobile Enterprise Application Platform based on Microsoft technologies has never been more important. Enable your CIO to achieve one of their top priorities—extending critical data from your organization’s backend systems out to employee’s mobile devices. That data needs to be secure and easily accessed, even if offline. Windows Phones and Tablets are enterprise-class devices with the capabilities needed to make employees successful by creating an agile, real-time enterprise platform. With enterprise mobility markets reaching $174 billion by 2017, according to analysts, it’s time to take action. Let us guide you through all the elements required to build a powerful Mobile Enterprise Application Platform. Use Microsoft SQL Server 2012 and IIS as your mobile middleware where SSIS adapters aggregate data from multiple back end systems. Rely on the ASP.NET Web API to expose composite data via wireless-friendly REST + JSON web services. Next, securely publish that data out to the Internet without the need for a VPN using UAG. Finally, your Windows Phone and Tablet Enterprise Apps will consume data and store it offline so employees can continue to be productive wherever they are in the absence of network connectivity.

item.title: All Aboard for the Future of HTML5 Mobile and Hybrid Web Apps for Windows Phone 8 and Windows Tablets
item.description: Do you know how to bypass app stores and reach the fastest growing segment of the Internet while blurring the lines between native apps and the Web? What will Gartner’s prediction mean for us, that in just 2 short years, 80% of all mobile applications developed will be hybrid or mobile web-oriented? Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 rise to this challenge by including Windows Internet Explorer 10 with hardware-accelerated HTML and graphics, JIT-compiled JavaScript, enhanced security and great support for HTML 5. In this session, we show Internet Explorer 10 capabilities provided by the W3C WebApps Working Group including IndexedDB and Web Storage for offline data, Web Sockets for bi-directional communication, Web Workers for threading, and XmlHttpRequest for calling web services. Take your web pages offline with App Cache and make them location-aware via the Geolocation API. We show you how to do this as well as how to build hybrid web apps that run inside a browser control with full platform capabilities.

item.title: Build It Once For Both: Writing Code and Designing for Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8
item.description: When you build cross-device applications you want to build it once, have it work across all devices and deliver the best user experience. With Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8, the WinRT kernel means that building across devices has never been easier. There are two important concepts we need to embrace in order to build the best cross-device applications. In this session, learn best practices for sharing code, focusing on portable class libraries. Then learn how to optimize the interfaces to most appropriately target your app for the best user experience while leveraging that shared code.

item.title: Secrets of Using Background Agents for Windows Phone 8
item.description: Want to easily add background agents to your Windows Phone applications and games? This demo packed session will give you a step-by-step guide so you can make games that download extra levels overnight and applications that can keep their users in-the-know via Live Tile updates. Every program can be improved with the addition of a little background magic, and this session will give you the skills in C# to create, debug and deploy that magic.

item.title: Speechifying your Windows Phone 8 Applications
item.description: Ever wanted to ask for all your music on the phone by name? Want an application to respond to your spoken question for a completely hands free experience? Voice control in Windows Phone 8 is a great way to engage with your users and get them hooked on your app. You will find out how to do this. Rob will show you how to dynamically create vocabularies and create speech output for a great speechifying experience.

item.title: Manage Windows Phone Enterprise Apps
item.description: Apps, apps, apps! Today all we hear is apps! Sure we can install apps from an app market but not all apps are for public consumption. How does your company go about creating the right apps for your employees, and how do those apps get onto smartphones your employees are using? After this session, you will be able to use the Windows Phone 8 company registration and verification process so you can easily and securely distribute and maintain native apps from your company’s Windows Phones.

item.title: The Top Down Guide for Developers: Windows Phone 8
item.description: What do you need to get started writing great applications for Windows Phone 8? You can now dramatically expand the way you build applications and games. Add new programming models and grow the application model so you have support for a broad range of creative scenarios you want to build. This is an in-depth exploration of the information you need to rock the app world!

item.title: Radical Perspectives on Mobility Strategy
item.description: Mobility just happened. The proliferation of mobile devices: smartphones, tablets, laptops, was forced upon IT by consumer demand. This thought-provoking session shows why a radically different approach to mobility platform investments is needed so IT departments can deliver against business expectations. This session provides you essential insights in the role Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 play in the evolution of client and mobile computing, and makes this is an essential session for IT decision makers in search of new perspectives on mobility.

item.title: Mobile Security in the Enterprise: Windows Phone 8 Answers the Call
item.description: Your company is probably allowing employees to use various devices to connect to the corporate network right now. How secure do you feel about your employee’s mobile devices, Smart Phones and Tablets being used as business tools? What kind of threat does this pose? How do you get this mobility trend under control before it becomes a risk, if it hasn’t already? Are you currently doing enough to protect your network, data and applications? By the end of this session, we will have targeted a number of security threats and recommend best practices to help you protect company data and applications. Not all smartphone ecosystems are created equal which is why Windows Phone 8 is a great choice for business.

item.title: The Phone That Has Everything the Enterprise Needs: Windows Phone 8
item.description: Your requirements for an Enterprise phone must meet the demands of your organization with mobile device management, security, encryption and private software distribution without sacrificing the excitement and fun of an awesome consumer phone. Microsoft’s newest phone has the power of Windows 8 with killer hardware and features like up-to-the minute Live Tiles, offline Nokia maps, great apps like Microsoft Office, Xbox, Skype, Pandora and ESPN, NFC, integrated VoIP and the fastest mobile browser. Windows Phone 8 is unrivaled in the smartphone space. Join us to see how Windows Phone 8 combines everything you love about a personal phone and everything you need in the Enterprise.

item.title: The Power of Collaboration: Integrating Windows Phone with Microsoft Office 365, Exchange and SharePoint Online
item.description: Anywhere access to communication and collaboration in a global world is critical to success. We all know this. Can your business be agile without it? Windows Phone 8 delivers the essential communication and collaboration tools you need. You will be guided on how to deploy Windows Phone 8 in an IT infrastructure with Exchange Server, and SharePoint or Office 365. The Windows Phone deployment story, Office integration on Windows Phone 8, SharePoint’s mobile capabilities, EAS and mobile device management with Exchange Service and Exchange Online give you everything you need to manage and control business needs from your corporate office while giving your employees anytime, anywhere access to the tools and services they need for success.

item.description: This lab provides an introduction to Windows OS deployment with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2012 Update 1 with support for Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.
