item.title: Implementing Role-Based Administration
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager provides a completely new and comprehensive security architecture in terms of managing which tasks administrators can perform, on which objects they can perform their assigned tasks, and on which sets of clients or users they can perform those tasks. In this lab, implement the role-based administration feature of Configuration Manager 2012 in order to provide administrator segmentation and security of a Configuration Manager 2012 environment.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager provides a completely new and comprehensive security architecture in terms of managing which tasks administrators can perform, on which objects they can perform their assigned tasks, and on which sets of clients or users they can perform those tasks. In this lab, implement the role-based administration feature of Configuration Manager 2012 in order to provide administrator segmentation and security of a Configuration Manager 2012 environment.

item.title: New for SP1: Implementing Linux Clients in Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: If your environment includes more than just Microsoft Windows operating systems, Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 provides support for various non-Windows operating systems. In this lab, implement an environment that includes not only Windows clients, but also a Linux client. Prepare the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 environment to support Linux/Unix servers as Configuration Manager 2012 clients, install the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 client agent on a Linux computer, and implement inventory and software distribution features to manage the Linux computer.
item.itunes:summary: If your environment includes more than just Microsoft Windows operating systems, Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 provides support for various non-Windows operating systems. In this lab, implement an environment that includes not only Windows clients, but also a Linux client. Prepare the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 environment to support Linux/Unix servers as Configuration Manager 2012 clients, install the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 client agent on a Linux computer, and implement inventory and software distribution features to manage the Linux computer.

item.title: New for SP1: Implementing Database Replication Controls in Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: If you have a hierarchy in Configuration Manager 2012, you know that there is a lot of data that flows between a central administration site and its child primary sites, or a primary site and any child secondary sites. In Configuration Manager 2012, you have no control over what data is replicated, when it is replicated, and how much is replicated. With the release of Configuration Manager 2012 SP1, you can now implement some controls over the database replication between sites. In this lab, implement the various controls we have over the database replication features of a Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 hierarchy.

With the release of Configuration Manager 2012 SP1, you can now implement some controls over the database replication between sites. In this lab, implement the various controls we have over the database replication features of a Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 hierarchy.

item.title: New for SP1: Implementing App-V 5.0 in Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: Are you using Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) to provide applications to end users? If so, Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 provides support for both App-V 4.6 SP2 as well as App-V 5.0. In this lab, create and deploy both versions of applications to end users, as well as implement an App-V 5.0 connection group.

item.title: New for SP1: Expanding a Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager Hierarchy
item.description: Trying to decide whether or not you should install a central administration site or just a stand-alone primary? In Configuration Manager 2012 SP1, you can easily start with a stand-alone primary, and then expand to a hierarchy when needed. In this lab, perform both a hierarchy expansion and a merger/acquisition scenario (with the migration feature) in Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.

item.title: New for SP1: Deploying Windows 8 Applications in Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 supports Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012 as a client platform. As part of that support, deployment of Windows 8 applications is necessary. In this lab, experience deployment of a Windows 8 application, including preparing the client for sideloading of the new application.

item.title: Migrating from Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007 to Configuration Manager 2012
item.description: The process of migrating from a Configuration Manager 2007 environment to System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager is not a complex one. However, as you migrate using a side-by-side migration process, there are specific steps and processes that must be completed. In this lab, perform a side-by-side migration from Configuration Manager 2007 to Configuration Manager 2012, including migrating administrative objects, as well as clients.
item.itunes:summary: The process of migrating from a Configuration Manager 2007 environment to System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager is not a complex one. However, as you migrate using a side-by-side migration process, there are specific steps and processes that must be completed. In this lab, perform a side-by-side migration from Configuration Manager 2007 to Configuration Manager 2012, including migrating administrative objects, as well as clients.

item.title: Managing Microsoft Software Updates
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager provides great capabilities for managing software updates, including new features, such as automatic deployment rules. In this lab, implement software update management in a Configuration Manager 2012 environment. Install a software update point, synchronize updates, scan clients for update compliance, create software update groups and deployments, as well as implement the new automatic deployment rule feature to help simplify the downloading, approving, and deploying of software updates in Configuration Manager.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager provides great capabilities for managing software updates, including new features, such as automatic deployment rules. In this lab, implement software update management in a Configuration Manager 2012 environment. Install a software update point, synchronize updates, scan clients for update compliance, create software update groups and deployments, as well as implement the new automatic deployment rule feature to help simplify the downloading, approving, and deploying of software updates in Configuration Manager.

item.title: Managing Content
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager has many new features in the area of content management. Some of these features include distribution point groups, collection association, content validation, prestaging content on distribution points, and more. In this lab, implement content management features to gain the knowledge and skills required to successfully manage content in Configuration Manager 2012.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager has many new features in the area of content management. Some of these features include distribution point groups, collection association, content validation, prestaging content on distribution points, and more. In this lab, implement content management features to gain the knowledge and skills required to successfully manage content in Configuration Manager 2012.

item.title: Managing Clients
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager provides new and exciting capabilities for managing clients, including automated client health evaluation and remediation, and customized client settings for collections. In this lab, validate that a client is considered healthy, break the client, and have Configuration Manager 2012 automatically repair the client to make it healthy again. Also, experience the process for managing client settings, both site-wide and collection-based.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager provides new and exciting capabilities for managing clients, including automated client health evaluation and remediation, and customized client settings for collections. In this lab, validate that a client is considered healthy, break the client, and have Configuration Manager 2012 automatically repair the client to make it healthy again. Also, experience the process for managing client settings, both site-wide and collection-based.

item.title: Managing Applications
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager adds the new application management feature for software distribution. Application deployment has many features over the classic packages and programs software distribution you are familiar with from Configuration Manager 2007. In this lab, experience many of the new features of the application model, including supersedence, automatic uninstallation of applications, and the new collection exclusion rule.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager adds the new application management feature for software distribution. Application deployment has many features over the classic packages and programs software distribution you are familiar with from Configuration Manager 2007. In this lab, experience many of the new features of the application model, including supersedence, automatic uninstallation of applications, and the new collection exclusion rule.

item.title: Introduction to Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager
item.description: The Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager product is a very big change from the Configuration Manager 2007 product. There are many new features and capabilities, and many changes to previous features. In this lab, use the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 administrator console to explore some of the new changes to the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 product. Start with exploring some of the new features of the Configuration Manager 2012 console, then look at new and updated features. If you are new to Configuration Manager 2012, this lab should be the first one you take to become familiar with the console, and to set the stage for attending additional labs on Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.

There are many new features and capabilities, and many changes to previous features. In this lab, use the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 administrator console to explore some of the new changes to the Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 product. Start with exploring some of the new features of the Configuration Manager 2012 console, then look at new and updated features. If you are new to Configuration Manager 2012, this lab should be the first one you take to become familiar with the console, and to set the stage for attending additional labs on Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.

item.title: Implementing Settings Management
item.description: Settings and compliance management is the new name for desired configuration management. Not only has the name changed, but it has many new features, such as browsing of master computers when creating configuration items, and automatic remediation. In this lab, implement the settings management feature, including creating of configuration items, browsing master systems, and creation of configuration baselines. Also, implement remediation of a configuration item and configuration baseline, and import a configuration pack from Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.
item.itunes:summary: Settings and compliance management is the new name for desired configuration management. Not only has the name changed, but it has many new features, such as browsing of master computers when creating configuration items, and automatic remediation. In this lab, implement the settings management feature, including creating of configuration items, browsing master systems, and creation of configuration baselines. Also, implement remediation of a configuration item and configuration baseline, and import a configuration pack from Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.

item.title: Implementing Microsoft System Center 2012 - Endpoint Protection
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Endpoint Protection is the newest release of Forefront Endpoint Protection. It is completely integrated into the System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager product, and uses the existing Configuration Manager 2012 features and capabilities to implement and manage antimalware and Windows firewall setting for clients using Endpoint Protection. In this lab, experience the end-to-end installation, configuration, and implementation of Endpoint Protection. Also, implement the new features of the SP1 release of Configuration Manager 2012, including real-time actions and the new Endpoint Dashboard.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Endpoint Protection is the newest release of Forefront Endpoint Protection. It is completely integrated into the System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager product, and uses the existing Configuration Manager 2012 features and capabilities to implement and manage antimalware and Windows firewall setting for clients using Endpoint Protection. In this lab, experience the end-to-end installation, configuration, and implementation of Endpoint Protection. Also, implement the new features of the SP1 release of Configuration Manager 2012, including real-time actions and the new Endpoint Dashboard.

item.title: Deploying Windows 8 to Bare Metal Clients
item.description: The process of capturing and deploying an operating system in Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager is fairly similar to that of Configuration Manager 2007. However, there are enhancements to operating system deployment in Configuration Manager 2012 SP1. In this lab, prepare your site to integrate with Windows Deployment Services (WDS) for use in a PXE deployment of Windows 8. Capture a Windows 8 reference system, then import that image into Configuration Manager 2012, and finally deploy it to a bare metal system. Also, configure the user device affinity relationship as part of the OSD process.
item.itunes:summary: The process of capturing and deploying an operating system in Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager is fairly similar to that of Configuration Manager 2007. However, there are enhancements to operating system deployment in Configuration Manager 2012 SP1. In this lab, prepare your site to integrate with Windows Deployment Services (WDS) for use in a PXE deployment of Windows 8. Capture a Windows 8 reference system, then import that image into Configuration Manager 2012, and finally deploy it to a bare metal system. Also, configure the user device affinity relationship as part of the OSD process.

item.title: Deploying Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager
item.description: While deploying a Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager site is somewhat similar to how you deploy a Configuration Manager 2007 site, there are still many differences you need to be aware of. In this lab, experience the process of deploying a Configuration Manager 2012 primary site, including post-installation configuration to support client deployment. Use Active Directory Forest Discovery, create boundaries and boundary groups, discover resources, install site systems, and install a client. Additionally, enable and use the new reporting feature of Configuration Manager 2012.
item.itunes:summary: While deploying a Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager site is somewhat similar to how you deploy a Configuration Manager 2007 site, there are still many differences you need to be aware of. In this lab, experience the process of deploying a Configuration Manager 2012 primary site, including post-installation configuration to support client deployment. Use Active Directory Forest Discovery, create boundaries and boundary groups, discover resources, install site systems, and install a client. Additionally, enable and use the new reporting feature of Configuration Manager 2012.

item.title: Deploying a Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager Hierarchy
item.description: Deploying a Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager hierarchy is quite different from how you deploy a Configuration Manager 2007 environment. You must deploy sites in a specific order using specific types of sites. And you must configure the hierarchy at site setup time (although the Service Pack 1 release of Configuration Manager 2012 provides some limited flexibility in modifying the hierarchy after installation). In this lab, experience the process of deploying a Configuration Manager 2012 hierarchy, including a central administration site, a primary site, as well as a secondary site.
item.itunes:summary: Deploying a Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager hierarchy is quite different from how you deploy a Configuration Manager 2007 environment. You must deploy sites in a specific order using specific types of sites. And you must configure the hierarchy at site setup time (although the Service Pack 1 release of Configuration Manager 2012 provides some limited flexibility in modifying the hierarchy after installation). In this lab, experience the process of deploying a Configuration Manager 2012 hierarchy, including a central administration site, a primary site, as well as a secondary site.

item.title: Basic Software Distribution
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager has many new features for distributing software to users and computers. In this lab, become familiar with the basics of software distribution in Configuration Manager 2012, including deploying packages and programs, and creating and deploying a simple application to clients. Experience the new Software Center application used for deploying software targeted to computers.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager has many new features for distributing software to users and computers. In this lab, become familiar with the basics of software distribution in Configuration Manager 2012, including deploying packages and programs, and creating and deploying a simple application to clients. Experience the new Software Center application used for deploying software targeted to computers.

item.title: Advanced Software Distribution
item.description: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager has many new features for distributing software to users and computers, as well as supporting the classic packages- and programs-based software distribution. In this lab, go beyond what you learned in the "Basic Software Distribution in Configuration Manager 2012" lab, and work with applications that have multiple deployment types, including requirement rules and dependencies. Also, configure user device affinity, and deploy an application to users, which then appears in the new Application Catalog. You should attend the "Basic Software Distribution in Configuration Manager 2012" lab prior to attending this one.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager has many new features for distributing software to users and computers, as well as supporting the classic packages- and programs-based software distribution. In this lab, go beyond what you learned in the "Basic Software Distribution in Configuration Manager 2012" lab, and work with applications that have multiple deployment types, including requirement rules and dependencies. Also, configure user device affinity, and deploy an application to users, which then appears in the new Application Catalog. You should attend the "Basic Software Distribution in Configuration Manager 2012" lab prior to attending this one.

item.title: Active Directory Deployment and Management Enhancements
item.description: In this lab, learn how to deploy Active Directory Domain Controllers with Windows Server 2012. Deploy domain controllers using the new Server Manager, as well as deploying remote domain controllers using Windows PowerShell. Explore the new Active Directory Management tool and use the PowerShell History Viewer.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, learn how to deploy Active Directory Domain Controllers with Windows Server 2012. Deploy domain controllers using the new Server Manager, as well as deploying remote domain controllers using Windows PowerShell. Explore the new Active Directory Management tool and use the PowerShell History Viewer.

item.title: Windows 8 Deployment Using Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2012 Update 1 and Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: Learn how to deploy Windows 8 images using Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2012 Update 1 integration.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to deploy Windows 8 images using Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2012 Update 1 integration.

item.title: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Setup and Configuration Lab
item.description: Learn how to setup User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) from scratch in this lab. You start with the base virtual machines and by the time you get done you have a working UE-V environment.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to setup User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) from scratch in this lab. You start with the base virtual machines and by the time you get done you have a working UE-V environment.

item.title: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Overview
item.description: This lab gives you an overview of how Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) can roam your experience between Windows versions and various application deployment methods. Also, learn how to rollback unexpected settings changes and create custom settings location templates for third-party or line-of-business applications.
item.itunes:summary: This lab gives you an overview of how Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) can roam your experience between Windows versions and various application deployment methods. Also, learn how to rollback unexpected settings changes and create custom settings location templates for third-party or line-of-business applications.

item.title: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT)
item.description: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) provides a set of tools that can help IT professionals reduce the challenges associated with troubleshooting and repairing system failures on Windows-based desktops, saving time for both them and users. In this lab, get first-hand experience creating DaRT 8 images, as well a learning how to deploy and use the standard DaRT 8 tools.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) provides a set of tools that can help IT professionals reduce the challenges associated with troubleshooting and repairing system failures on Windows-based desktops, saving time for both them and users. In this lab, get first-hand experience creating DaRT 8 images, as well a learning how to deploy and use the standard DaRT 8 tools.

item.title: Microsoft Bitlocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) v2
item.description: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) v2 provides a simplified administrative interface to BitLocker Drive Encryption (BDE). MBAM v2 has integration options with Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager, self-service key recovery, and enforcement options. MBAM allows you to select BDE encryption policy options appropriate to your enterprise, monitor client compliance with those policies, generate reports on the encryption status of missing devices, and quickly provide BDE recovery keys to end users that have entered recovery mode.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) v2 provides a simplified administrative interface to BitLocker Drive Encryption (BDE). MBAM v2 has integration options with Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager, self-service key recovery, and enforcement options. MBAM allows you to select BDE encryption policy options appropriate to your enterprise, monitor client compliance with those policies, generate reports on the encryption status of missing devices, and quickly provide BDE recovery keys to end users that have entered recovery mode.

item.title: Implementing and Managing Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0
item.description: This lab provides a walk-through of common management tasks for the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Beta. The tasks include installing and configuring the infrastructure including the Management Server, Publishing Server, database, and then implementing and managing the App-V 5.0 client and Remote Desktop Services Client for Shared Content Store.
item.itunes:summary: This lab provides a walk-through of common management tasks for the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Beta. The tasks include installing and configuring the infrastructure including the Management Server, Publishing Server, database, and then implementing and managing the App-V 5.0 client and Remote Desktop Services Client for Shared Content Store.

item.title: Getting Started with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2012 Update 1
item.description: This lab offers an introduction to Windows OS deployment with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2012 Update 1 with support for Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.
item.itunes:summary: This lab offers an introduction to Windows OS deployment with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2012 Update 1 with support for Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.

item.title: Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0: Flexible Virtualization with Virtual Application Connection, Virtual Application Extension and Dynamic Configuration
item.description: In this lab, see how Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 allows IT administrators to choose the right level of isolation or integration for their virtual applications, and then delivers them, along with custom configuration, to users and computers. Virtual Application Connection and Virtual Application Extension allow virtual applications to communicate with other virtual and even local applications. Dynamic Configuration allows IT to deliver varied configurations to different users and computers, all based on a single virtual application package.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, see how Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 allows IT administrators to choose the right level of isolation or integration for their virtual applications, and then delivers them, along with custom configuration, to users and computers. Virtual Application Connection and Virtual Application Extension allow virtual applications to communicate with other virtual and even local applications. Dynamic Configuration allows IT to deliver varied configurations to different users and computers, all based on a single virtual application package.

item.title: Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Sequencing, Migration and Coexistence
item.description: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 enables you to build on your existing Microsoft Application Virtualization investments. In this lab, learn how to migrate your existing virtual application packages to App-V 5.0 and how to deploy the App-V 5.0 client side-by-side with the App-V 4.6 client.
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 enables you to build on your existing Microsoft Application Virtualization investments. In this lab, learn how to migrate your existing virtual application packages to App-V 5.0 and how to deploy the App-V 5.0 client side-by-side with the App-V 4.6 client.

item.title: New for SP1: Upgrading from Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager to Configuration Manager 2012 SP1
item.description: You likely already have Configuration Manager 2012 RTM installed in your environment, and have heard about all the great features that Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 brings to the product. In this lab, see how to prepare for, and upgrade, your existing Configuration Manager 2012 RTM environment to Configuration Manager 2012 SP1. Upgrade the site server, as well as a client computer.
item.itunes:summary: You likely already have Configuration Manager 2012 RTM installed in your environment, and have heard about all the great features that Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 brings to the product. In this lab, see how to prepare for, and upgrade, your existing Configuration Manager 2012 RTM environment to Configuration Manager 2012 SP1. Upgrade the site server, as well as a client computer.

item.title: Hardcore Debugging
item.description: The title says Hard Core for a reason. If you think it's possible for a 400-level session to be too technical, then I guarantee this one is. But if you don't, or if you just want to have your brain melted anyway, then join a group of Microsoft's greatest debuggers for a session designed to enlighten and entertain as you learn new techniques and watch people push the envelope on what's possible with our debugging platform. A fan favorite since TechReady 7!

item.title: Pieces of 8: Prospecting for Windows 8 Gold
item.description: Windows 8 is out, and there is a LOT to learn in it. Sure, everyone knows that it's downright "touching" in its new interface, but have you gotten around to building a simple Windows Store app and sideloading it? Taken the 2000 new Windows PowerShell cmdlets out for a spin to find the Twelve New Cmdlets You Can't Live Without? Constructed a Windows To Go USB stick... the hard way? Well, if not, don't worry—best-selling technical author Mark Minasi has been diving Windows in search of buried treasure since Microsoft's biggest OS shipped with Othello, and he's pulled plenty of "pieces of eight" from the latest edition. If you haven't had the time to crack open the new "primary PC" feature in Windows 8, then you're just leaving buried treasure in your infrastructure. Join Mark for a fast-paced exposition of the useful, the essential, and the fun. Don't you want to know what REALLY happens when you do a Windows 8 Refresh? Or how to build and easily deploy custom Start Screens? Sure you do... so we'll see you there.

item.title: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V): How to Manage and Deploy UE-V across an Enterprise
item.description: This session gives you an overview of how Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) provides users a seamless experience as they move between machines, by allowing them to roam their OS and application settings. This session introduces the tools to deploy and manage UE-V across an enterprise. Discussions focus on how to set up and deploy UE-V, management of the UE-V agent via group policy, and also monitoring compliance of the agent and configuration with the configuration pack for Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager.
item.itunes:summary: This session gives you an overview of how Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) provides users a seamless experience as they move between machines, by allowing them to roam their OS and application settings. This session introduces the tools to deploy and manage UE-V across an enterprise. Discussions focus on how to set up and deploy UE-V, management of the UE-V agent via group policy, and also monitoring compliance of the agent and configuration with the configuration pack for Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager.
item.dc:creator: Tim Crabb

item.title: Windows Store Apps: Enterprise LOB App Deployment Scenarios
item.description: Using WinRT APIs and design principles, Windows 8, and Windows RT are introducing a new type of application. Enterprises are being encouraged to create these, as well as consume third-party apps. This sesson reviews the technical requirements, how sideloading is perfomed, challenges that may be encountered in this process.
item.itunes:summary: Using WinRT APIs and design principles, Windows 8, and Windows RT are introducing a new type of application. item.title: Windows RT in the Enterprise
item.description: In this session, learn about appropriate and inappropriate scenarios for using Windows RT in enterprise environments: challenges to overcome, as well as known issues and limitations.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, learn about appropriate and inappropriate scenarios for using Windows RT in enterprise environments: challenges to overcome, as well as known issues and limitations.
item.dc:creator: Mike Niehaus

item.title: Windows Intune Overview
item.description: Windows Intune delivers management as a service for Internet connected users. In this session, we share the new features and demonstrate functionality delivered in the latest service release of Windows Intune.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Intune delivers management as a service for Internet connected users. In this session, we share the new features and demonstrate functionality delivered in the latest service release of Windows Intune.
item.dc:creator: Martin Booth

item.title: Internet Explorer 10 Administration
item.description: Internet Explorer 10 is easy to use, but beneath the hood there are about 1,500 Group Policies you can use to fine-tune Internet Explorer 10 and help with compatibility issues. This session covers best practices for deploying and managing Internet Explorer 10, including a detailed walk–through of the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK), relevant group policies, deployment options, and a special look at web app compatibility for IT pros.
item.itunes:summary: Internet Explorer 10 is easy to use, but beneath the hood there are about 1,500 Group Policies you can use to fine-tune Internet Explorer 10 and help with compatibility issues. This session covers best practices for deploying and managing Internet Explorer 10, including a detailed walk–through of the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK), relevant group policies, deployment options, and a special look at web app compatibility for IT pros.

item.title: Windows 8: Essential Security Features Every Admin Should Know About
item.description: Many enterprises are jumping into Windows 8 and will bypass both Windows Vista and Windows 7. Don't miss out on enterprise ready security features that only Windows 8 Enterprise edition can offer. During this session Andrew Bettany MVP (Windows Expert - IT Pro) focuses on new features and enhancements such as BitLocker Pre-Provisioning, BitLocker Automatic unlock, Bitlocker To Go, Windows To Go, VPN Reconnect Credential Manager and Secure Boot. If you are deploying Windows 8 then you should already be considering some of these security features that have a high impact on your enterprise.
item.itunes:summary: Many enterprises are jumping into Windows 8 and will bypass both Windows Vista and Windows 7. Don't miss out on enterprise ready security features that only Windows 8 Enterprise edition can offer. During this session Andrew Bettany MVP (Windows Expert - IT Pro) focuses on new features and enhancements such as BitLocker Pre-Provisioning, BitLocker Automatic unlock, Bitlocker To Go, Windows To Go, VPN Reconnect Credential Manager and Secure Boot. If you are deploying Windows 8 then you should already be considering some of these security features that have a high impact on your enterprise.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Bettany

item.title: Windows 8: Blackbelt Troubleshooting
item.description: Windows 8 offers new and updated tools for troubleshooting the OS. Come and see how Windows OS MVP and STEP member Sami Laiho with more than 16 years of experience in advanced troubleshooting combines these new tools with industry proven techniques. Major changes to the startup sequence like the ones in Windows 8 haven’t been seen since the introduction of Windows NT, so there’s a lot to learn.
item.itunes:summary: Windows 8 offers new and updated tools for troubleshooting the OS. Come and see how Windows OS MVP and STEP member Sami Laiho with more than 16 years of experience in advanced troubleshooting combines these new tools with industry proven techniques. item.title: Windows 8 Image Engineering: Notes from the Field
item.description: Want to understand how to decrease the time required to develop an image engineering and deployment infrastructure based on Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2012 for deploying Windows 8? Come along to this session to learn how to rapididly set up MDT for building, customizing, and deploying the Windows 8 operating systems. See how pre-canned scripts, application placeholders, a centralized image engineering customsettings.ini, and a customized deployment share with custom task sequences can be added quickly to the MDT 2012 environment.
item.itunes:summary: Want to understand how to decrease the time required to develop an image engineering and deployment infrastructure based on Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2012 for deploying Windows 8? Come along to this session to learn how to rapididly set up MDT for building, customizing, and deploying the Windows 8 operating systems. See how pre-canned scripts, application placeholders, a centralized image engineering customsettings.ini, and a customized deployment share with custom task sequences can be added quickly to the MDT 2012 environment.

item.title: What's New in Windows Server 2012 Virtual Desktop Infrastructure and Remote Desktop Services
item.description: Coming Soon.

item.title: What's New in Windows 8 Deployment
item.description: Now that Windows 8 is generally available, it is important for enterprises to begin integrating it into their plans. In this session, we dig into the technical aspects of Windows 8 deployment projects, including changes in the tools, technologies, and processes used for deploying.
item.itunes:summary: Now that Windows 8 is generally available, it is important for enterprises to begin integrating it into their plans. In this session, we dig into the technical aspects of Windows 8 deployment projects, including changes in the tools, technologies, and processes used for deploying.
item.dc:creator: Mike Niehaus

item.title: What's New in Infrastructure: Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager Infrastructure Improvements and Hierarchy Design
item.description: This session walks you through the infrastructure improvement in Configuration Manager 2012 SP1, including migration between Configuration Manager 2012 hierarchies, expansion of a standard primary site, enhancement of Microsoft SQL Server replication monitoring, and upgrading to Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.
item.itunes:summary: This session walks you through the infrastructure improvement in Configuration Manager 2012 SP1, including migration between Configuration Manager 2012 hierarchies, expansion of a standard primary site, enhancement of Microsoft SQL Server replication monitoring, and upgrading to Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.
item.dc:creator: Jason Adams

item.title: What's New with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2012 Update 1
item.description: Join this session to hear what’s new in Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2012 Update 1, and how MDT 2012 can help you deploy Windows 8. New features in MDT 2012 Update 1 include Build Your Own Pages for UDI, Monitoring for Configuration Manager, DaRT 8 support, Windows PowerShell 3.0 support, merged ZTI and UDI task sequences, among several other improvements.
item.itunes:summary: Join this session to hear what’s new in Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2012 Update 1, and how MDT 2012 can help you deploy Windows 8. New features in MDT 2012 Update 1 include Build Your Own Pages for UDI, Monitoring for Configuration Manager, DaRT 8 support, Windows PowerShell 3.0 support, merged ZTI and UDI task sequences, among several other improvements.
item.dc:creator: Mike Niehaus, Aaron Czechowski

item.title: What's New in Windows Server 2012 Active Directory
item.description: As an infrastructure and security architect, John Craddock has been involved in enterprise systems since the early days of Windows NT. His passion is for determining how things really work and then designing and deploying the most effective systems. John presented on Active Directory at one of the first Windows 2000 launch conferences in Geneva; of course this was only after delving deep into its inner workings. Now it’s time for Windows Server 2012 Active Directory to be scrutinized. Come to this demo-packed session and discover what Windows Server 2012 Active Directory has to offer. Learn about virtualizing and cloning DCs, GUI improvements for password policies and the recycle bin, new Kerberos features, and more.
item.itunes:summary: As an infrastructure and security architect, John Craddock has been involved in enterprise systems since the early days of Windows NT. His passion is for determining how things really work and then designing and deploying the most effective systems. John presented on Active Directory at one of the first Windows 2000 launch conferences in Geneva; of course this was only after delving deep into its inner workings. Now it’s time for Windows Server 2012 Active Directory to be scrutinized. Come to this demo-packed session and discover what Windows Server 2012 Active Directory has to offer. Learn about virtualizing and cloning DCs, GUI improvements for password policies and the recycle bin, new Kerberos features, and more.
item.dc:creator: John Craddock

item.title: VDI Smackdown 2013 Edition
item.description: More and more customers see the benefits of server-hosted virtual desktops (VDI). There are several important players in this market space, and from a marketing perspective these solutions have a lot in common. This presentation is based on industry analysis and customer cases and covers the basics of desktop virtualization, the good/bad/ugly, impact on storage, the technical differences between the vendors, and tips on how to choose the right solution. Join Ruben Spruijt (MVP, CTP and vExpert - CTO @ PQR) as he provides opinions and great discussion on such topics. Specific areas covered also include: The Flexible work style and the role of Remote Desktop Services Virtualization Host; VDI: the good, bad and ugly; the performance impact on storage and how different storage technologies solve the ‘VDI + storage = deep impact' challenge; analysis and evaluation of Citrix XenDesktop, Microsoft RDVH with Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012 and VMware View; and the advantages/disadvantages of the different VDI solutions, updated February 2013. Get up to speed with RDVH - Windows 8 and Server 2012. This is the session you should attend!

item.title: Unified Modern Device Management with Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager Integrated with Windows Intune
item.description: System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager Service Pack 1 and Windows Intune provide a unified approach for device management on-premise and through the cloud. Come and learn how this can help organizations address the complex issues raised by Bring Your Own Device scenarios. Go deep into the deployment options and how these will enable single pane of glass management of Windows, Mac OS X, Windows RT, Windows Phone 8, iOS, and Android devices.

item.title: Understanding Windows To Go: Supported Use Cases, Hardware Considerations, and Deployment Options in the Enterprise
item.description: With Windows 8 we redefined workforce mobility by introducing a new feature called Windows To Go, that enables enterprises to provide users a managed corporate environment on a USB drive that they can operate from multiple managed or unmanaged PCs. In addition to reviewing Windows To Go messaging, this session focuses on key supported use cases and deployment considerations, answering top frequently asked questions, and providing guidance on deploying and managing Windows To Go in the enterprise.
item.itunes:summary: With Windows 8 we redefined workforce mobility by introducing a new feature called Windows To Go, that enables enterprises to provide users a managed corporate environment on a USB drive that they can operate from multiple managed or unmanaged PCs. In addition to reviewing Windows To Go messaging, this session focuses on key supported use cases and deployment considerations, answering top frequently asked questions, and providing guidance on deploying and managing Windows To Go in the enterprise.
item.dc:creator: Craig Ashley

item.title: Tuning Images for VDI Usage
item.description: The current version of the Windows OS works great in a virtualized environment, but it is possible to tweak it a bit more. This session is all about that and nothing else. We show you all the small things you can do to cram the extra out of an image that is supposed to be used in a virtualized environment. This session covers both Server OS and Client OS.
item.itunes:summary: The current version of the Windows OS works great in a virtualized environment, but it is possible to tweak it a bit more. This session is all about that and nothing else. We show you all the small things you can do to cram the extra out of an image that is supposed to be used in a virtualized environment. This session covers both Server OS and Client OS.
item.dc:creator: Mikael Nystrom

item.title: The Future Is Now! Next Generation Remote Access Today with Windows Server 2012 DirectAccess
item.description: Are you still using legacy VPN for remote network access? You're doing it wrong! DirectAccess is the remote access solution of the future. With always-on remote access, users can be more productive and organizations will be more secure. In this session we provide a high-level overview of DirectAccess, then drill down in to the technologies that are used to provide seamless and transparent remote network connectivity.
item.itunes:summary: Are you still using legacy VPN for remote network access? You're doing it wrong! DirectAccess is the remote access solution of the future. With always-on remote access, users can be more productive and organizations will be more secure. In this session we provide a high-level overview of DirectAccess, then drill down in to the technologies that are used to provide seamless and transparent remote network connectivity.
item.dc:creator: Richard Hicks

item.title: Solving the 'Needle in a Haystack' Dilemma with Citrix and Microsoft
item.description: Trying to find the right architecture for delivering virtual apps and desktops together is often like trying to find a needle in a haystack. What are the new features and functions that exist with Citrix and Microsoft that can make it easier on any Desktops n Apps (DNA) admin or architect to help solve this challenge? Can I use deployment types like Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 and Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager with XenDesktop and XenApp? How would my performance be if I decided to virtualize these apps, and what tips and tricks can I learn ahead of time? This session features plenty of technical demonstrations and one lucky winner will also walk away with a Samsung SSD so don’t miss it! Products covered: Citrix XenDesktop, Provisioning Server, XenApp, Hyper-V 2012 and System Center Configuration Manager 2012 SP1m, App-V 5

item.title: Replacing BIOS with a UEFI Deployment
item.description: In this session, learn about the benefits of the Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) as a BIOS replacement. In addition to benefits, see common UEFI configurations and management scenarios, and a demonstration integrating UEFI in your deployment process with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2012 Update 1 and Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager SP1.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, learn about the benefits of the Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) as a BIOS replacement. item.dc:creator: Alfred Ojukwu, Frank Pinto

item.title: Upgrading the Platform - How to Get There! Part 2: Reimagining and Migrating Your Active Directory
item.description: This session shows how you can redesign what you have now to be ready for the future. Rethink your ideas on Active Directory design and deployment. Restructure your Active Directory design to be more efficient by leveraging virtualized and automated DC deployment with DC cloning. Manage your systems more efficiently with Windows PowerShell and Active Directory Administrative Center regardless if they are Core shell deployments or Full GUI deployments. This demo-heavy session is sure to have something for Active Directory administrators and architects alike.

This demo-heavy session is sure to have something for Active Directory administrators and architects alike.
item.dc:creator: Andrew McMurray, Rick Claus

item.title: Raiders of the Elevated Token: Understanding User Account Control and App Capabilities in Windows 8
item.description: After its debut in Windows Vista, User Account Control has had major improvements. Still, lots of people tend to turn it off. In Windows 8 User Account Control is here to stay. Why are some applications still requesting elevation? Can I still turn off User Account Control in Windows 8 and should I? This session demonstrates how User Account Control is a part of Windows 8 and how Modern UI Apps are affected. Demos show how security-related compatibility issues caused by legacy applications can be analyzed and what solutions are available to fix them yourself. The session has an overview of potential issues and what tools can enable you to take control over both legacy applications and web applications accessed by Windows Internet Explorer 10.

item.description: This session reviews the recommended guidance and tools available to help customers prepare their Windows 8 virtual machine templates for use within VDI.

item.title: Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager Overview
item.description: Join this session to hear about all the new functionality with System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager, such as support for the deployment and management of Windows 8, unified mobile device management with Windows Intune, support for Mac OS X and Linux/Unix clients, infrastructure improvements and more. This session reviews all the new capabilities in Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.

item.title: Microsoft IT: How We Upgrade Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager Hierarchy (Almost) Every Month Using Orchestrator Automation
item.description: Learn how Microsoft IT is now using Microsoft System Center - Orchestrator runbooks to upgrade the Configuration Manager hierarchy end-to-end (almost) every month. Take away some ideas/tips on how to build an automation framework using Orchestrator that is product agnostic and independent of environment. Hear from us on what we learned about automating Configuration Manager environment.

item.title: Managing Embedded Devices with Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: This session demonstrates management of Windows Embedded devices, such as those used in retail stores and healthcare, with Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.
item.itunes:summary: This session demonstrates management of Windows Embedded devices, such as those used in retail stores and healthcare, with Configuration Manager 2012 SP1.
item.dc:creator: Hema Rajalakshmi

item.title: Making PC Recovery Easier with the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT)
item.description: We have all seen it happen, a user deletes a file off their laptop and realizes they need it back, or their pc that blue screens on boot and the user needs it working ASAP. This session shows you how the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) can be used to help you solve these problems and many more, while helping you accelerate desktop repair onsite and remotely.

item.title: Integrating the New Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 with other Virtualization Solutions
item.description: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) along with Citrix is often a BIG combination at many large companies. It enables customers to optimize their virtualization strategy. This session not only encompasses the new App-V 5.0 application provisioning, we also demonstrate additional methods of integrating access to applications via Citrix Xen publishing and Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager packages.

item.title: Integrating RDS with Microsoft System Center 2012 - Virtual Machine Manager Service Templates: Complete Automation for RemoteApps and Remote Desktops
item.description: RDS offers a powerful platform for delivering applications, either atop Windows servers or virtualized Windows desktops. Yet one of the hardest tasks in RDS administration is ensuring enough resources are available to handle the user load. The solution: Automation, and specifically the kinds of automation you get by integrating RDS with System Center Virtual Machine Manager Service Templates. Join globally-renowned Microsoft MVP Greg Shields from Concentrated Technology and discover a smarter path to RemoteApp and remote desktop administration. Learn how best to build your RDS environment inside VMM and expose ridiculously-powerful provisioning, deprovisioning, monitoring, and management automation.

item.title: Information Protection in 2013: Hybrid RMS, Generic Protection, and iOS/Android/WinRT Support
item.description: Microsoft offers Active Directory Rights Management Service (ADRMS) in Windows Server today. Windows Azure Active Directory Rights Management is a new service from Microsoft that is tightly integrated with Microsoft Office and Office 365. These two services combine to support layered information protection offers such as: Office, Exchange DLP, File Classification, SharePoint Secure Libraries, and more. These offers support seven platforms with mobile applications, offer generic protection of all file types, business-to-business secure collaboration, and the ability to quickly deploy information protection services on-premises by leveraging cloud infrastructure. This hybrid offer enables HSM-based key storage, secure B2B collaboration, and enables your organization to maintain their documents on-premise if so desired! This first of two talks covers Microsoft's overall information protection offer as well as recent advances. Part 2 (Information Protection in 2013: Customer Readiness and Implementation Considerations) delves deeper into preparing for these offers as well as implementation considerations. Part 1 is a prerequisite for part 2.

item.title: Implementing Self-Service Desktop Refresh in Six Easy Steps with Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: Self-service? Desktop refresh? Easy? These are three terms you never expected to see together in a session description, and it wasn't too long ago that you wouldn’t. Today, however, System Center Configuration Manager offers to revolutionize how we refresh user desktops. The biggest facet of that change is enabling users to do it themselves. Accomplishing this requires a careful orchestration of OS deployment, drivers, updates, applications, configurations, and that all-important user state data. Microsoft MVP Greg Shields from Concentrated Technology has been automating desktop deployment since the very beginning. He’s also an automation master with Configuration Manager. Join him in this 75-minute power session and learn his six easy steps in completely automating one of the most time-consuming tasks in IT.

item.title: Implementing Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0: Lessons Learned from a Production Rollout
item.description: In this session we discuss real-life experiences and lessons learned implementing Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 based on both personal observations as well as by supporting a TAP (Technical Adaption Program) customer who already rolled out in a production environment. This demo-rich session focuses on the key selling points for this customer and why they chose App-V 5.0 over a previous version for their 4000 seat VDI environment. It discusses the impact of migrating to this new platform as well as some of the pitfalls that were experienced during the process from both infrastructure and packaging perspectives.
item.itunes:summary: In this session we discuss real-life experiences and lessons learned implementing Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 based on both personal observations as well as by supporting a TAP (Technical Adaption Program) customer who already rolled out in a production environment. item.title: How to Develop a Successful Flexible Workspace Strategy (BYOD, Consumerization, VDI, Tablet)
item.description: New desktop technologies such as BYOD, VDI, Slates, Consumerization, among other pressures are causing many IT environments to consider re-architecting their desktop infrastructure. In this session, hear predictions, market trends, and then proceed to separate myths from facts by reviewing the market analysis over time. This strategy focuses on meeting your users desktop requirements based on roles / personas, rather than implying that one technology fits all.
item.itunes:summary: New desktop technologies such as BYOD, VDI, Slates, Consumerization, among other pressures are causing many IT environments to consider re-architecting their desktop infrastructure. In this session, hear predictions, market trends, and then proceed to separate myths from facts by reviewing the market analysis over time. This strategy focuses on meeting your users desktop requirements based on roles / personas, rather than implying that one technology fits all.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Kassner

item.title: How Many Coffees (New 2013 Edition) Can You Drink While Your PC Starts?
item.description: You can solve slow boot and slow logon in your enterprise! In this (new 2013 edition) “Case of…” style presentation we share real-world examples and insider tips from Microsoft IT and other enterprises on the causes of slow boot and slow logon. We measure user productivity gains/losses in terms of cups of coffee consumed while waiting for PC, but your business could measure the impact in millions of dollars per year. Be the hero that saves the Windows user experience from heavy handed management layers and badly behaving apps. We are living through a competitive “Bring Your Own Device” era where businesses are re-evaluating management control versus user satisfaction. Now is the time to achieve the right balance and optimize your Windows experience at work. In this session MC Stephen Rose sets the stage, while Matthew Reynolds from Microsoft Services walks you through diagnosis of the most common real-world slow boot and slow logon issues using the Windows Performance Toolkit. We also go beyond diagnostics to share stories of enterprises working their way toward improvement and some of the non-technical challenges they have overcome.

item.title: x86, x64 or ARM? Forget the Details and Use Remote Resources to Run Any App on Your Windows Device
item.description: This session demos how easy it is to use Remote Resources (Remote Desktop Sessions, Remote Apps, and VDI) from any Windows 8 and Windows RT machine. When you buy a Windows RT device you get one free Client Access License (CAL) to use in a virtual environment, and that license will allow you to run normal (x86) Apps in a virtualized environment and stream transparently to your devices.

item.dc:creator: Joao Botto

item.title: Field Experience: Troubleshooting Long Boot and High Resource Consumptions
item.description: Do you want to get insides what is happening in User or Kernel Mode? Do you receive a lot of support cases where your users complain about system performance? Do you want to be able to break a thread execution into the nanoseconds and explain what is going around? Or want to get insight into how Microsoft troubleshoots long boot times? Then this is your session. Join us and get our worldwide field experience around how Microsoft resolves long boot or high resource consumption issues by utilizing the Windows Performance Toolkit.

item.title: Designing a Virtual Desktop Infrastructure Architecture for Scale and Performance on Window Server 2012
item.description: Remote Desktop Services in WS2012 can scale to 1000’s of desktops with fault tolerance, but you need to know how to design and tune such a deployment. At this session, we will show several models for a large scale VDI architecture, and cover the latest performance and tuning information out of the RDV product group.
item.itunes:summary: Remote Desktop Services in WS2012 can scale to 1000’s of desktops with fault tolerance, but you need to know how to design and tune such a deployment. At this session, we will show several models for a large scale VDI architecture, and cover the latest performance and tuning information out of the RDV product group.
item.dc:creator: Adam Carter, Ara Bernardi

item.title: Deploying Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager with Windows Intune at Microsoft
item.description: This session walks through the experience of deploying Configuration Manager SP1 with Windows Intune and managing devices at Microsoft IT using System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager SP1 for on-premises management and Windows Intune for management through the cloud. Learn how Microsoft updated the hierarchy, work done to deploy Configuration Manager 2012 SP1, and understand how Microsoft IT has enabled employees to add mobile devices managed through the cloud with Windows Intune into their Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 console and manage all the devices through one tool.

item.dc:creator: Arun Ramakrishnan, Marc Hurley

item.title: Deploying and Managing Windows 8 with Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager
item.description: Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 supports the management of Windows 8. In this session we provide a deep technical overview of the capabilities in SP1 that support deploying and managing Windows 8 features. This includes but is not limited to enhancements in Operating System Deployment, such as support for Windows To Go, changes to Application Management to support new Windows 8 applications, and changes to the Configuration Manager client to effectively manage Always-on Always-Connected capable Windows 8 devices.
item.itunes:summary: Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 supports the management of Windows 8. In this session we provide a deep technical overview of the capabilities in SP1 that support deploying and managing Windows 8 features. This includes but is not limited to enhancements in Operating System Deployment, such as support for Windows To Go, changes to Application Management to support new Windows 8 applications, and changes to the Configuration Manager client to effectively manage Always-on Always-Connected capable Windows 8 devices.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Czechowski

item.title: Deploying and Managing Virtual Applications and Settings with Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager and MDOP
item.description: In this session, learn how Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 and Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP) technologies can be integrated to provide users access to the applications that they need, along with their custom application and Windows settings, anywhere in the enterprise without installing applications directly on their desktops, laptops, or virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) sessions. This session features demonstrations of creating virtualized applications using Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V), generating custom settings templates for Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V), and deploying and managing App-V and UE-V with System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager SP1.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, learn how Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 and Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP) technologies can be integrated to provide users access to the applications that they need, along with their custom application and Windows settings, anywhere in the enterprise without installing applications directly on their desktops, laptops, or virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) sessions. This session features demonstrations of creating virtualized applications using Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V), generating custom settings templates for Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V), and deploying and managing App-V and UE-V with System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager SP1.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Gilbert (MSD-IX)

item.title: Deploying and Configuring Mobile Device Management Infrastructure with Microsoft System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager and Windows Intune
item.description: This session dives into what you’ll do at the server level to drive Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 and Windows Intune integration for mobile device management. The session includes subscription, connectors, certificates, Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), DirSync, among other server configurations that enable Mobile Device Management.

item.title: Demonstrations of Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit Tools
item.description: With the release of Windows 8, a new and updated set of tools has been released. This session provides an overview of all the tools in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK), paying close attention to the changes and enhancements in existing tools, as well as new tools added in this version.

item.title: Configuring and Tuning Windows 8
item.description: How do you configure your clients? We walk through the new Group Policies in Windows 8 and other tools to make your system better and more secure. Expect demos and tips from Microsoft Springboard and TechNet. And of course lots of Windows 8 stuff like tuning the new start menu, Windows store and more. Windows RT is also covered. Includes LOTS of demos.

item.title: Case Study: How Microsoft IT is Using Microsoft System Center 2012 - Configuration Manager
item.description: Join this session to learn how Microsoft IT is using System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager. This session focuses on day-to-day client management, tips and tricks from leveraging new features such as Client Auto upgrade, managing modern applications, Windows 8 deployment, MAC client rollout and administration, hierarchy upgrade (Microsoft SQL Server 2012 & Windows Server 2012), and App-V 5.0 integration.
item.itunes:summary: Join this session to learn how Microsoft IT is using System Center 2012 SP1 - Configuration Manager. This session focuses on day-to-day client management, tips and tricks from leveraging new features such as Client Auto upgrade, managing modern applications, Windows 8 deployment, MAC client rollout and administration, hierarchy upgrade (Microsoft SQL Server 2012 & Windows Server 2012), and App-V 5.0 integration.
item.dc:creator: Arun Ramakrishnan, Marc Hurley

item.title: Case of the Unexplained 2013: Windows Troubleshooting with Mark Russinovich
item.description: Come hear Mark Russinovich, the master of Windows troubleshooting, walk you step-by-step through how he has solved seemingly unsolvable system and application problems on Windows. With all new real case studies, Mark shows how to apply the Microsoft Debugging Tools and his own Sysinternals tools, including Process Explorer, Process Monitor, to solve system crashes, process hangs, security vulnerabilities, DLL conflicts, permissions problems, registry misconfiguration, network hangs, and file system issues. These tools are used on a daily basis by Microsoft Product Support and have been used effectively to solve a wide variety of desktop and server issues, so being familiar with their operation and application will assist you in dealing with different problems on Windows.

item.title: Building the Perfect Windows 8 Image
item.description: In this session you learn how to create the perfect, real-world, production ready, master image of Windows 8. You learn how Sysprep and the Unattend.xml really work in Windows 8. You learn to automate builds of think, hybrid and thick images, and what to add to an image, and what not to add. As foundation for creating the master images, Microsoft Deployement Toolkit 2012 Update 1 and the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) are used. You can expect lots of live demos in this session.

item.description: Configuration Manager gives users access to business applications on a wide array of platforms. This session includes Windows 8 app delivery to Windows 8, Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0, Mac, Linux, Windows RT, Windows Phone 8, iOS, and Android inclusive of new functionality enabled by SP1 and Windows Intune.

item.title: App Compat for Nerds
item.description: Are you a delivery resource who is responsible for app compat troubleshooting and remediation? Then this session is for you. We get deep and grungy into broken applications and seek to understand not only how to troubleshoot them, but also how to help customers to build more durable solutions. Get ready for a demo-heavy journey through busted apps for both Windows and the web! Especially good if you are new to the app compat space!

item.title: Securing Windows 8 Clients and Resources from Threats
item.description: Windows 8 offers a rich set of new features that change the game when it comes to Windows client security. Come join us to learn about one of the key scenarios that we’ve delivered which enables Windows 8 to secure clients and resources from threats in a completely new way. During this session we discuss Trusted Boot, Measured Boot, Remote Attestation, Virtual Smartcards, and even third-party features in the context of an end-to-end scenario where a company is able to ensure that a customer account is being accessed from a healthy device and is vetted using strong authentication before access to resources is granted.
item.itunes:summary: Windows 8 offers a rich set of new features that change the game when it comes to Windows client security. Come join us to learn about one of the key scenarios that we’ve delivered which enables Windows 8 to secure clients and resources from threats in a completely new way. During this session we discuss Trusted Boot, Measured Boot, Remote Attestation, Virtual Smartcards, and even third-party features in the context of an end-to-end scenario where a company is able to ensure that a customer account is being accessed from a healthy device and is vetted using strong authentication before access to resources is granted.
item.dc:creator: Chris Hallum

item.title: What's New with Windows 8 BitLocker and Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Management (MBAM) 2.0
item.description: Come join us to learn about the top new features in Windows 8 BitLocker and how MBAM 2.0 will enhance the management of BitLocker drive encryption on Window 7 and Windows 8 PCs with new capabilities such as Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager integration, Self-Service Portal, just to name a few.
item.itunes:summary: Come join us to learn about the top new features in Windows 8 BitLocker and how MBAM 2.0 will enhance the management of BitLocker drive encryption on Window 7 and Windows 8 PCs with new capabilities such as Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager integration, Self-Service Portal, just to name a few.
item.dc:creator: Paul MacKnight, Chris Hallum

item.title: Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Migration and Co-Existence with 4.6
item.description: Join us to learn the new capabilities in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0; how it provides customers an integrated platform so that virtual applications behave like locally installed applications, and provides more flexible virtualization options so that IT can virtualize numerous applications that need a high level of interaction. This session also focuses on the process of migrating from App-V 4.6 to App-V 5.0, including co-existence of the App-V 4.6 Client and the App-V 5.0 Client. The process of migrating App-V 4.6 packages to App-V 5.0 includes using the App-V 5.0 Package Converter tool and the process of customizing converted packages to leverage the new App-V 5.0 features.
item.itunes:summary: Join us to learn the new capabilities in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0; how it provides customers an integrated platform so that virtual applications behave like locally installed applications, and provides more flexible virtualization options so that IT can virtualize numerous applications that need a high level of interaction. This session also focuses on the process of migrating from App-V 4.6 to App-V 5.0, including co-existence of the App-V 4.6 Client and the App-V 5.0 Client. The process of migrating App-V 4.6 packages to App-V 5.0 includes using the App-V 5.0 Package Converter tool and the process of customizing converted packages to leverage the new App-V 5.0 features.
item.dc:creator: Matthijs Gates, Madhvi Mishra

item.title: Understanding Access and Information Protection
item.description: Today, people want to work anywhere on any device. How do you enable this, yet retain control and meet compliance requirements? In this session we take a look at how the Microsoft boundary control and information protection solutions allow you to have your cake, and eat it too!
item.itunes:summary: Today, people want to work anywhere on any device. How do you enable this, yet retain control and meet compliance requirements? In this session we take a look at how the Microsoft boundary control and information protection solutions allow you to have your cake, and eat it too!
item.dc:creator: Adam Hall

item.title: The Replaceable PC
item.description: The average user carries three to four devices. In this session, learn how to do it once, and see it on all devices. We dive into client virtualization and synchronization technologies like Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V), Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V), Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager, Microsoft Skydrive Pro and more, to show how you can have everything moving from device to device seamlessly.
item.itunes:summary: The average user carries three to four devices. In this session, learn how to do it once, and see it on all devices. We dive into client virtualization and synchronization technologies like Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V), Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V), Microsoft System Center - Configuration Manager, Microsoft Skydrive Pro and more, to show how you can have everything moving from device to device seamlessly.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Rose

item.title: Sequencing Applications Using the New Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Sequencer
item.description: This session covers how to sequence virtual applications to all of your environment platforms. This is an in-depth review of the sequencing process during which you learn how an application is transformed from an installed entity into a virtualized application using the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Sequencer. The session takes you behind the scenes to show you how to create the virtual environment for applications, define dependencies to a package, manage files in the Virtual File System and the Virtual Registry, and demonstrate how it relates to the Windows 8 OS. We demonstrate the use of Virtual Application Connections (VAC) and Virtual Application Extension (VAE) groups for managing application provisioning.
item.itunes:summary: This session covers how to sequence virtual applications to all of your environment platforms. This is an in-depth review of the sequencing process during which you learn how an application is transformed from an installed entity into a virtualized application using the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 Sequencer. The session takes you behind the scenes to show you how to create the virtual environment for applications, define dependencies to a package, manage files in the Virtual File System and the Virtual Registry, and demonstrate how it relates to the Windows 8 OS. We demonstrate the use of Virtual Application Connections (VAC) and Virtual Application Extension (VAE) groups for managing application provisioning.
item.dc:creator: Henry Schulman, Steve Thomas

item.title: Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 and Microsoft Office: Better Together
item.description: This session focuses on the seamless integration between Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 and Microsoft Office 2013. We take a deep dive into how customers can build the Office 2013 App-V package using the Office deployment tool, and how they can customize the package using the new technologies delivered in App-V 5.0. We also discuss the support for Office 2010 on App-V 5.0.
item.itunes:summary: This session focuses on the seamless integration between Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 and Microsoft Office 2013. We take a deep dive into how customers can build the Office 2013 App-V package using the Office deployment tool, and how they can customize the package using the new technologies delivered in App-V 5.0. We also discuss the support for Office 2010 on App-V 5.0.
item.dc:creator: Matt Yandek

item.title: Experience Design for Windows Apps
item.description: The new focus on touch and touch experiences and being able to use that with the Windows aesthetic to connect with users is an important part of delivering a great experience. This session focuses on building a great experience and using the native look and feel along with the cloud to really connect with users through good design practices.
item.itunes:summary: The new focus on touch and touch experiences and being able to use that with the Windows aesthetic to connect with users is an important part of delivering a great experience. This session focuses on building a great experience and using the native look and feel along with the cloud to really connect with users through good design practices.
item.dc:creator: David Kelley

item.title: Everything You Ever Wanted to Know about Windows, But Were Afraid to Ask
item.description: Join Windows Product Managers Stephen Rose, Brad McCabe, Chris Hallum, Craig Ashley, and Michae Niehaus for an in-depth Q&A session covering all your questions ranging from features and security, through implementation and deployment. This is a great chance to meet the faces behind the product and get your key Windows questions answered by the experts.
