This is a great chance to meet the faces behind the product and get your key Windows questions answered by the experts.
item.dc:creator: Mike Niehaus, Brad McCabe, Stephen Rose, Chris Hallum, Craig Ashley

item.title: Getting to Know Windows Azure IaaS, Part 2 (repeated from 6/4 at 5pm)
item.description: Whether you build apps or support the infrastructure that runs the apps, the cloud can be a really big place. For some, it’s a natural evolution for their application and infrastructure to embrace the power and scale of the cloud. For others, it’s a journey that has to begin with a single step. Windows Azure provides that first step with a scalable, flexible platform for deploying your applications your way. With our Infrastructure as a Service platform (IaaS) called Windows Azure Virtual Machines, you get the flexibility to choose between Windows and Linux with full control over the operating system configuration and installed software, matched with the portability of Hyper-V disk images. Windows Azure Virtual Machines provide the perfect environment for meeting all of your Infrastructure-as-a-Service needs. To learn more about our Infrastructure as a Service platform, we invite all developers and IT professionals to join Matt Hester as he introduces you to the Microsoft Cloud Platform, dives deep into Windows Azure Virtual Machines, and helps walk you through a hands-on demonstration of the power of IaaS on the Windows Azure platform. This is part 2 of 2. In order to attend this session you need to attend WAD-IL201 first. The lab requires you to connect to the Windows Azure Portal, where you will provision three separate virtual machines in the cloud and configure them each via a Remote Desktop client connection. All participants need to have access for Windows Azure prior to the lab. You can register for a FREE 90-day trial of the Windows Azure prior to the lab. You can sign up for your FREE trial here: http://aka.ms/IaasBootCamp.

item.title: Lap Around Workflow Manager
item.description: Come learn about Workflow Manager! Workflow Manager provides the capability to host Microsoft .NET workflows in a high scale, highly available environment, both on-premises using Windows Server and in the cloud using Windows Azure.
item.itunes:summary: Come learn about Workflow Manager! Workflow Manager provides the capability to host Microsoft .NET workflows in a high scale, highly available environment, both on-premises using Windows Server and in the cloud using Windows Azure.

item.title: Build Your Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 Lab in the Cloud with Windows Azure
item.description: Leverage Windows Azure Virtual Machines and Virtual Networks to build your SharePoint 2013 server lab in the cloud! During this hands on lab, lget a technical overview of Windows Azure virtual machines and virtual networks and then proceed to build a SharePoint 2013 cloud lab that you can leverage post-TechEd to extend your learning experience.
item.itunes:summary: Leverage Windows Azure Virtual Machines and Virtual Networks to build your SharePoint 2013 server lab in the cloud! During this hands on lab, lget a technical overview of Windows Azure virtual machines and virtual networks and then proceed to build a SharePoint 2013 cloud lab that you can leverage post-TechEd to extend your learning experience.

item.title: Getting the Most out of Windows Azure Storage
item.description: In a world increasingly dominated by mobile and cloud computing, application developers require durable, scalable, reliable, and fast storage solutions like Windows Azure Storage.  In this session, learn how to get the most out of storage, patterns and best practices for developing performant solutions on storage that optimize for cost, latency, and throughput. Find out how to best develop mobile apps using storage, how to monitor, analyze and improve your storage apps. You don't want to iss this session, which is heavy on code and real-world examples that you can leverage.

item.dc:creator: Joe Giardino

item.title: Developing Hybrid Solutions with Microsoft BizTalk Server 2013 and Windows Azure
item.description: The Service Bus is part of Windows Azure and is designed to provide connectivity, queuing, and routing capabilities not only for the cloud applications but also to on-premises applications. Microsoft BizTalk Server enables organizations to connect and extend heterogeneous systems across the enterprise and with trading partners. Using both together enables a significant number of scenarios in which you can build secure, reliable, and scalable hybrid solutions that span the cloud and on-premises environments. In this session, learn how to integrate these technologies to build secure, reliable and scalable hybrid solutions that span the cloud and on-premises environments.

item.dc:creator: Rajesh Ramamirtham

item.title: Designing and Building Disaster Recovery Enabled Solutions in Windows Azure
item.description: One of the biggest problems we have in an application and its data is the fact that we need it to be able to survive a disaster of any kind, from a Natural Disaster to a Vendor Disaster. In the cloud this is even more important because we need to understand how to prepare ourselves for that, since in some cases we "seem" not to have the same control over the data, and so in this session we talk about some of the Windows Azure capabilities and features that help us be prepared for disasters, and also to better prepare our apps and data to survive them.

item.dc:creator: Nuno Godinho

item.title: Windows Azure Internals
item.description: Mark Russinovich goes under the hood of the Microsoft datacenter operating system. Intended for developers who have already gotten their hands dirty with Windows Azure and understand its basic concepts, this session gives an inside look at the architectural design of the Windows Azure compute platform. Learn about Microsoft’s data center architecture, what goes on behind the scenes when you deploy and update a Windows Azure app and how it monitors and responds to the health of machines, its own components, and the apps it hosts.
item.itunes:summary: Mark Russinovich goes under the hood of the Microsoft datacenter operating system. Intended for developers who have already gotten their hands dirty with Windows Azure and understand its basic concepts, this session gives an inside look at the architectural design of the Windows Azure compute platform. item.dc:creator: Mark Russinovich

item.title: Building Elastic, Autoscalable Solutions with Windows Azure
item.description: In this session, learn how to implement true elasticity for your Windows Azure solutions. See how to automate the scaling of your Worker/Web Role instances depending on predictable usage patterns. Whether you expect high load during business hours and low load during the nights, or have different resource allocation needs, this session on using the Enterprise Library Integration Pack for the Windows Azure Autoscale Application Block shows you how your Windows Azure solutions can achieve higher levels of elasticity.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, learn how to implement true elasticity for your Windows Azure solutions. See how to automate the scaling of your Worker/Web Role instances depending on predictable usage patterns. Whether you expect high load during business hours and low load during the nights, or have different resource allocation needs, this session on using the Enterprise Library Integration Pack for the Windows Azure Autoscale Application Block shows you how your Windows Azure solutions can achieve higher levels of elasticity.
item.dc:creator: Mihai Tătăran

item.title: Building Private Clouds Using Windows Azure Services for Windows Server
item.description: Coming Soon.
item.itunes:summary: Coming Soon.
item.dc:creator: Bradley Bartz

item.title: Developing iOS and Android Apps with Windows Azure Mobile Services
item.description: Windows Azure Mobile Services is capable of supporting a number of platforms including iOS and Android. At this session, we’ll review the different options you have for building your iOS and Android apps including native SDKs, Xamarin and the MonoFramework, and PhoneGap. All with great support from Mobile Services so you can take advantage of shared data, authentication, and push notifications no matter how you’re building your apps. We’ll go over each feature and see how to use it with live coding demonstrations. You’ll leave with a good understanding of how to build your iOS and Android apps with a powerful and scalable backend.

item.dc:creator: Chris Risner

item.title: Build Real-World Modern Apps with Windows Azure Mobile Services on Windows Store, Windows Phone or Android
item.description: Join me for and in-depth walkthrough of everything you need to know to build an engaging and dynamic app with Mobile Services. See how to work with geospatial data, multiple auth providers (including custom identity), periodic push notifications and your favorite APIs through scripts. We'll begin with a Windows Store app then point Windows Phone and Android apps to the same Mobile Service in order to ensure a consistent experience across devices. We’ll finish up with versioning APISs.

item.dc:creator: Nick Harris

item.title: Connected Clients and Continuous Services with Windows Azure Service Bus
item.description: Applications today run on connected clients (mobile, devices) and rely on continuous services to provide rich and current content to users. Come learn about Windows Azure Service Bus that support building these applications by providing several features, from notification on mobile to connecting embedded devices. Also, see how you can build services using Relay and messaging patterns to unlock data and services from datacenters.

Come learn about Windows Azure Service Bus that support building these applications by providing several features, from notification on mobile to connecting embedded devices. Also, see how you can build services using Relay and messaging patterns to unlock data and services from datacenters.
item.dc:creator: Abhishek Lal

item.title: Designing Cloud Architectures
item.description: Come and learn best practices and common patterns you can apply to your Windows Azure solutions. In this session you’re introduced to practical solutions to common tasks and scenarios you may face in your projects, including dealing with long-running tasks, failovers, federated security across different system layers, and many more design patterns being successfully used in various Windows Azure projects.
item.itunes:summary: Come and learn best practices and common patterns you can apply to your Windows Azure solutions. In this session you’re introduced to practical solutions to common tasks and scenarios you may face in your projects, including dealing with long-running tasks, failovers, federated security across different system layers, and many more design patterns being successfully used in various Windows Azure projects.
item.dc:creator: Haishi Bai, Sebastian Renzi

item.title: Windows Azure Web Sites: An Architecture and Technical Deep Dive
item.description: Windows Azure Web Sites is one of the fastest growing services on the Windows Azure Platform. It provides a flexible and scalable hosting solution for web applications on top of Windows Azure and Windows Server. Simplifying the full life-cycle delivery of modern Web applications on the Microsoft private, hybrid and public clouds. In this session we’ll review why Windows Azure Websites is the best platform for hosting your web applications and provide detail on the design and architecture behind the service.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Azure Web Sites is one of the fastest growing services on the Windows Azure Platform. It provides a flexible and scalable hosting solution for web applications on top of Windows Azure and Windows Server. Simplifying the full life-cycle delivery of modern Web applications on the Microsoft private, hybrid and public clouds. In this session we’ll review why Windows Azure Websites is the best platform for hosting your web applications and provide detail on the design and architecture behind the service.
item.dc:creator: Calvin Keaton

item.title: Windows Azure Web Sites and On-Premises Connectivity
item.description: Windows Azure Web Sites is a great platform for hosting web applications and APIs written in Microsoft ASP.NET, Node.js, PHP, and Python. Customers who want to move into cloud technology a step at a time find great success when initiating their move to cloud by standing up their website presence using Windows Azure Web Sites. Many developers who aim to move to the cloud want to do so in phases. For these situations, many questions arise around how to connect a website back to an on-premises enterprise or even to connect to a Microsoft Office 365 site. In this session, various techniques of connecting a Windows Azure Web Site to an on-premises enterprise architecture are discussed. Through a series of deep-dive demonstrations using Service Bus, SignalR, data marts, and Windows Azure Active Directory, you are introduced to the opportunities that enable communication between Windows Azure Web Sites and your enterprise environment. If you've been wanting to get started with Web Sites but have been unable to conceptualize how you can set up a hybrid environment using Windows Azure, this session will clear the air and give you some ideas of what's possible.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Azure Web Sites is a great platform for hosting web applications and APIs written in Microsoft ASP.NET, Node.js, PHP, and Python. Customers who want to move into cloud technology a step at a time find great success when initiating their move to cloud by standing up their website presence using Windows Azure Web Sites. Many developers who aim to move to the cloud want to do so in phases. For these situations, many questions arise around how to connect a website back to an on-premises enterprise or even to connect to a Microsoft Office 365 site. In this session, various techniques of connecting a Windows Azure Web Site to an on-premises enterprise architecture are discussed. Through a series of deep-dive demonstrations using Service Bus, SignalR, data marts, and Windows Azure Active Directory, you are introduced to the opportunities that enable communication between Windows Azure Web Sites and your enterprise environment. If you've been wanting to get started with Web Sites but have been unable to conceptualize how you can set up a hybrid environment using Windows Azure, this session will clear the air and give you some ideas of what's possible.
item.dc:creator: Brady Gaster

item.title: Maximum Performance: Accelerate Your Cloud Services Applications with Windows Azure Caching
item.description: This session is a deep dive into the new Windows Azure Caching on role instances, first introduced in the Windows Azure 1.8 release October 2012. This session reviews the Caching features, and then provides demos and walkthroughs of implementing several key scenarios, including configuring dedicated and co-located cache topologies, using the capacity guide planner to determine the right cache cluster settings, best practices for implementing caching in your applications, and an overview of troubleshooting and diagnostics using the caching diagnostic level introduced in Windows Azure 1.8.
item.itunes:summary: This session is a deep dive into the new Windows Azure Caching on role instances, first introduced in the Windows Azure 1.8 release October 2012. This session reviews the Caching features, and then provides demos and walkthroughs of implementing several key scenarios, including configuring dedicated and co-located cache topologies, using the capacity guide planner to determine the right cache cluster settings, best practices for implementing caching in your applications, and an overview of troubleshooting and diagnostics using the caching diagnostic level introduced in Windows Azure 1.8.
item.dc:creator: Alok Jain, Steve Danielson

item.title: IaaS + PaaS = <3
item.description: This session covers the best of IaaS and PaaS, providing you with recipes for building highly scalable Microsoft .NET-connected applications on Windows Server using Cloud Services and Virtual Machines.
item.itunes:summary: This session covers the best of IaaS and PaaS, providing you with recipes for building highly scalable Microsoft .NET-connected applications on Windows Server using Cloud Services and Virtual Machines.
item.dc:creator: Brian Blanchard

item.title: Build Your First Cloud App: An Introduction to Windows Azure Cloud Services
item.description: So you're a Microsoft .NET developer who is ready to see what cloud has to offer. Come take a peek at Windows Azure Cloud Services, the fastest and most productive way to capture the benefits of cloud without leaving .NET and Microsoft Visual Studio—and without calling your IT department!
item.itunes:summary: So you're a Microsoft .NET developer who is ready to see what cloud has to offer. Come take a peek at Windows Azure Cloud Services, the fastest and most productive way to capture the benefits of cloud without leaving .NET and Microsoft Visual Studio—and without calling your IT department!
item.dc:creator: Craig Kitterman

item.title: Key Ingredients for Building Hybrid (Cross-Premises) Cloud Applications
item.description: One of the key challenges for organizations wanting to move to the public cloud is determining which applications or services can be moved externally and which services are required to remain internal. The challenge frequently comes from not being able to determine how their application can leverage External IaaS, PaaS along with their private cloud resources. Let's face it, when it comes to applications there is no "one size fits all" approach. This session walks through a demonstration of a "Hybrid Cloud Application" scenario where Windows Azure IaaS and PaaS are leveraged along with on-premise resources. The primary technologies used in this demonstration are Windows Azure (IaaS and PaaS) along with Microsoft System Center 2012 - Virtual Machine Manager and System Center 2012 - App Controller.
item.itunes:summary: One of the key challenges for organizations wanting to move to the public cloud is determining which applications or services can be moved externally and which services are required to remain internal. The challenge frequently comes from not being able to determine how their application can leverage External IaaS, PaaS along with their private cloud resources. Let's face it, when it comes to applications there is no "one size fits all" approach. This session walks through a demonstration of a "Hybrid Cloud Application" scenario where Windows Azure IaaS and PaaS are leveraged along with on-premise resources. The primary technologies used in this demonstration are Windows Azure (IaaS and PaaS) along with Microsoft System Center 2012 - Virtual Machine Manager and System Center 2012 - App Controller.
item.dc:creator: Annur Sumar

item.title: Developing Connected Windows Store Apps with Windows Azure Mobile Service: Overview
item.description: Join us for a demo-packed introduction to how Windows Azure Mobile Services can bring your Windows Store and Windows Phone 8 apps to life. We look at Mobile Services end-to-end and how easy it is to add authentication, secure structured storage, and send push notifications to update live tiles. We also cover adding some business logic to CRUD operations through scripts as well as running scripts on a schedule. Learn how to point your Windows Phone 8 and Windows Store apps to the same Mobile Service in order to deliver a consistent experience across devices.
item.itunes:summary: Join us for a demo-packed introduction to how Windows Azure Mobile Services can bring your Windows Store and Windows Phone 8 apps to life. We look at Mobile Services end-to-end and how easy it is to add authentication, secure structured storage, and send push notifications to update live tiles. We also cover adding some business logic to CRUD operations through scripts as well as running scripts on a schedule. Learn how to point your Windows Phone 8 and Windows Store apps to the same Mobile Service in order to deliver a consistent experience across devices.
item.dc:creator: Nick Harris

item.title: Building Rich Media Applications with Windows Azure Media Services
item.description: In this session we introduce client ecosystem of Windows Azure Media Services. With this set of video services built on top of the Windows Azure platform, you could create and deliver rich media with a high-quality viewing experience on a global scale, to various platform and devices. We emphasize how to build rich media applications on various platforms, such as Windows 8, desktop, iOS, and Flash.
item.itunes:summary: In this session we introduce client ecosystem of Windows Azure Media Services. With this set of video services built on top of the Windows Azure platform, you could create and deliver rich media with a high-quality viewing experience on a global scale, to various platform and devices. item.dc:creator: Mingfei Yan

item.title: Building Media Workflows in the Cloud with Windows Azure Media Services
item.description: Come and learn how to build media workflows for encoding, encrypting, and delivering media to multiple formats and devices. Learn how to ingest content securely into the cloud using the Media Services SDK for .NET and partner applications from Aspera. Watch as the Media Services team encodes content in the cloud and delivers to multiple devices including your own! Get insight into the roadmap for Windows Azure Media Services features including PlayReady DRM protection, License Delivery, and Live Streaming.
item.itunes:summary: Come and learn how to build media workflows for encoding, encrypting, and delivering media to multiple formats and devices. Learn how to ingest content securely into the cloud using the Media Services SDK for .NET and partner applications from Aspera. Watch as the Media Services team encodes content in the cloud and delivers to multiple devices including your own! Get insight into the roadmap for Windows Azure Media Services features including PlayReady DRM protection, License Delivery, and Live Streaming.
item.dc:creator: Mingfei Yan

item.title: Microsoft BizTalk Server 2013 in Windows Azure IaaS
item.description: This session looks at the architecture of three new integration infrastructure scenarios that are made possible with BizTalk Server 2013 on Windows Azure IaaS. These scenarios include: Small Scale All Cloud, Hybrid Cloud Burst, and Near-Infinite Scale All Cloud. This session walks through each scenario in detail and explains the best use for each, including a cost analysis. Demos are provided to show key aspects of each scenario.
item.itunes:summary: This session looks at the architecture of three new integration infrastructure scenarios that are made possible with BizTalk Server 2013 on Windows Azure IaaS. These scenarios include: Small Scale All Cloud, Hybrid Cloud Burst, and Near-Infinite Scale All Cloud. This session walks through each scenario in detail and explains the best use for each, including a cost analysis. Demos are provided to show key aspects of each scenario.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thomas

item.title: Messaging with Windows Azure Service Bus
item.description: Windows Azure Service Bus offers a rich set of messaging capabilities in the cloud as well as on-premises. This session discusses some of the advanced messaging capabilities in Service Bus. Join us to learn about publish-subscribe patterns, Using the Service Bus sessions, interoperability with AMQP, scaling with Service Bus, and messaging strategies for server to cloud federation.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Azure Service Bus offers a rich set of messaging capabilities in the cloud as well as on-premises. This session discusses some of the advanced messaging capabilities in Service Bus. Join us to learn about publish-subscribe patterns, Using the Service Bus sessions, interoperability with AMQP, scaling with Service Bus, and messaging strategies for server to cloud federation.
item.dc:creator: Ziv Rafalovich

item.title: Introduction to Windows Azure Active Directory
item.description: Windows Azure Active Directory provides easy-to-use, multi-tenant identity management services for applications running in the cloud and on any device and any platform. In this session, developers, administrators, and architects take an end-to-end tour of Windows Azure Active Directory to learn about its capabilities, interfaces and supported scenarios, and understand how it works in concert with Windows Server Active Directory.
item.itunes:summary: Windows Azure Active Directory provides easy-to-use, multi-tenant identity management services for applications running in the cloud and on any device and any platform. In this session, developers, administrators, and architects take an end-to-end tour of Windows Azure Active Directory to learn about its capabilities, interfaces and supported scenarios, and understand how it works in concert with Windows Server Active Directory.
item.dc:creator: Jono Luk, Ross Adams

item.title: Deep Dive into the Windows Azure Active Directory Graph API: Data Model, Schema, Query, and More
item.description: Would you like to build applications that can potentially be used by thousands of Microsoft Cloud Customers? This session shows how to develop applications that integrate with Windows Azure Active Directory using the Graph API, a new RESTful interface for accessing directory data hosted in Windows Azure Active Directory. There is a tremendous opportunity for developers to build new applications that integrate with Windows Azure Active Directory, which is the directory for Windows Azure, Microsoft Office 365, Windows Intune, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, and Global Services Monitoring customers. We present the directory data model, and demonstrate how easy and intuitive it is to write an application that connects with Windows Azure Active Directory. We also show integration with single sign-on with Azure Active Directory, and how a Multi-tenant App could be built, and offered to customers. Microsoft .NET, Java, and PHP examples are demonstrated.
item.itunes:summary: Would you like to build applications that can potentially be used by thousands of Microsoft Cloud Customers? This session shows how to develop applications that integrate with Windows Azure Active Directory using the Graph API, a new RESTful interface for accessing directory data hosted in Windows Azure Active Directory. There is a tremendous opportunity for developers to build new applications that integrate with Windows Azure Active Directory, which is the directory for Windows Azure, Microsoft Office 365, Windows Intune, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, and Global Services Monitoring customers. We present the directory data model, and demonstrate how easy and intuitive it is to write an application that connects with Windows Azure Active Directory. We also show integration with single sign-on with Azure Active Directory, and how a Multi-tenant App could be built, and offered to customers. Microsoft .NET, Java, and PHP examples are demonstrated.
item.dc:creator: Edward Wu

item.title: Securing Cloud Line-of-Business and SaaS Web Applications Using Windows Azure Active Directory
item.description: Active Directory enabled generations of developers to focus on their business applications’ features rather than worrying about identity management. Windows Azure Active Directory is Active Directory re-imagined for the cloud, designed to solve for you the new identity and access challenges that come with the shift to a cloud-centric, multi-tenant world. Come to this session to learn how to take advantage of Windows Azure Active Directory in your application.  If you already have an investment in Active Directory and Visual Studio, you’ll discover that Windows Azure Active Directory is a way of extracting even more value from your investment.  If your solution runs on different platforms, you’ll appreciate how easily you can integrate with Windows Azure Active Directory via open standards such as the SAML protocol and the REST-based Graph API.

item.dc:creator: Vittorio Bertocci

item.title: Take Control of the Cloud with the Windows Azure PowerShell Cmdlets
item.description: In this session, learn how to tame the simplest to most advanced Windows Azure deployments with the Windows Azure PowerShell cmdlets. Automate repetitive tasks and learn how build advanced reproducible deployments so you can save time and money while working in the cloud. The presenter covers dev-ops scenarios with Virtual Machines and Cloud Services in this demo-packed session.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, learn how to tame the simplest to most advanced Windows Azure deployments with the Windows Azure PowerShell cmdlets. Automate repetitive tasks and learn how build advanced reproducible deployments so you can save time and money while working in the cloud. The presenter covers dev-ops scenarios with Virtual Machines and Cloud Services in this demo-packed session.

item.title: Continuous Integration with Team Foundation Services and Windows Azure Websites
item.description: Ever felt you spend more time packing deployments, configuring test environments, and deploying the latest build, in order to please the testers, than you spend writing actual code? Had your flow interrupted by the boss wanting a demo environment set-up for a customer demo? We simply can't be interrupted in our creational flow of #awesome code by the worldly dealings of these simpletons! Fortunately, built into the Windows Azure Platform, there is great support for Continuous Delivery of the greatness you just built. With little fuss you can set up automated builds, test runs and deployments so that you may focus on what’s important—the uninterrupted development experience. Everything that can be automated must be automated!

item.title: Windows Azure Store
item.description: The Windows Azure Store allows developers who are building applications using the Windows Azure open cloud platform to easily discover, purchase, and use app services and data sets which enhance their Windows Azure development experience.
item.itunes:summary: The Windows Azure Store allows developers who are building applications using the Windows Azure open cloud platform to easily discover, purchase, and use app services and data sets which enhance their Windows Azure development experience.
item.dc:creator: Asim Mitra, Chris Lattner

item.title: Patterns and Practices for Running Large Multi-Tenant SaaS Service on Windows Azure (How It’s Made: MyGet.org)
item.description: Ever wonder how some applications are built, or how to combine some components of the Windows Azure platform? Stop wondering and learn how we’ve built MyGet.org, a multi-tenant software-as-a-service. In this session we discuss architecture, commands, events, access control, multi-tenancy and how to mix and match those things together in a reliable, cost-effective solution that scales.

item.title: Managing Projects with Microsoft SharePoint and Microsoft Project Professional (repeated from 6/4 at 3:15pm)
item.description: This lab has been very popular among Project Managers as well as people who just manage a set of tasks. Don’t miss the opportunity to be walked through the New Microsoft Project and learn about the functionality that can help you every day! This lab highlights the key investments in Microsoft Project Professional 2013 and Project Pro for Office 365 and the new capabilities of building the schedule in a SharePoint list and seamlessly connecting the two—giving the Project Manager instant insight through the new reporting and additional tools to successfully manage the project, schedule, and resources. This lab is available as an Instructor-led Lab where a skilled instructor walks you through this topic!

item.description: Regardless if you are a SharePoint guru exploring other advanced workloads or a Project or Portfolio Manager—don’t miss the opportunity to be walked through Project Server 2013, which is built on top of Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013! item.title: Using Business Connectivity Services (BCS) with the New Microsoft SharePoint Online
item.description: This lab walks you through the configuration and required patterns to leverage BCS in the new SharePoint Online. During the lab, learn how to create an app catalog and then deploy the custom app within the admin interface.
item.itunes:summary: This lab walks you through the configuration and required patterns to leverage BCS in the new SharePoint Online. During the lab, learn how to create an app catalog and then deploy the custom app within the admin interface.

item.title: Working with Site Mailboxes in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: Site Mailboxes bring together Microsoft Exchange emails and SharePoint documents into a central “filing cabinet” that can be accessed and edited only by site members. Under the covers, content is kept where it belongs (e.g., Exchange for emails, SharePoint for docs) but is visible through Microsoft Outlook 2013 or SharePoint. Benefits of site mailboxes include application of common compliance policies at the mailbox level and better management of time-bound projects. This lab walks users through the configuration and usage of the new Site Mailbox feature.
item.itunes:summary: Site Mailboxes bring together Microsoft Exchange emails and SharePoint documents into a central “filing cabinet” that can be accessed and edited only by site members. Under the covers, content is kept where it belongs (e.g., Exchange for emails, SharePoint for docs) but is visible through Microsoft Outlook 2013 or SharePoint. Benefits of site mailboxes include application of common compliance policies at the mailbox level and better management of time-bound projects. This lab walks users through the configuration and usage of the new Site Mailbox feature.

item.title: Working with List Definitions and Event Receivers in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this lab, you build an app for SharePoint that adds a list definition to the host web along with an event receiver that will call custom code.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, you build an app for SharePoint that adds a list definition to the host web along with an event receiver that will call custom code.

item.title: Working with eDiscovery in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: The new eDiscovery capabilities in SharePoint, Microsoft Exchange and Microsoft Lync Server 2013 enables legal teams to discover and export content including microblogs, wiki pages, social feeds, instant messages, emails and more to better protect their businesses—and all without IT intervention or impact to end users. This lab walks users through the new eDiscovery experience in SharePoint 2013 and Exchange 2013, including the tools to discover, preserve content in-place, refine, and export content for review.
item.itunes:summary: The new eDiscovery capabilities in SharePoint, Microsoft Exchange and Microsoft Lync Server 2013 enables legal teams to discover and export content including microblogs, wiki pages, social feeds, instant messages, emails and more to better protect their businesses—and all without IT intervention or impact to end users. This lab walks users through the new eDiscovery experience in SharePoint 2013 and Exchange 2013, including the tools to discover, preserve content in-place, refine, and export content for review.

item.title: What's New with ECM in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab walk users through the new Enterprise Content Management (ECM) capabilities delivered in SharePoint 2013.
item.itunes:summary: This lab walk users through the new Enterprise Content Management (ECM) capabilities delivered in SharePoint 2013.

item.title: Overview of IT Professional Features in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: SharePoint Server 2013 Preview is designed to work how you work—providing scale and performance capabilities to grow with your business. SharePoint Server 2013 carries forward the solid architecture provided in SharePoint Server 2010, but also includes new capabilities designed to support the most demanding workloads. This lab introduces you to key new IT Professional features in SharePoint Server 2013.
item.itunes:summary: SharePoint Server 2013 Preview is designed to work how you work—providing scale and performance capabilities to grow with your business. SharePoint Server 2013 carries forward the solid architecture provided in SharePoint Server 2010, but also includes new capabilities designed to support the most demanding workloads. This lab introduces you to key new IT Professional features in SharePoint Server 2013.

item.title: Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 Search Connectors and Using BCS
item.description: This lab teaches how to use connectors in SharePoint Server 2013 to access and search across external data sources. Starting with a simple example using SharePoint Designer, the participant moves on to explore and implement a custom BCS connector in Microsoft Visual Studio. The connector shows how to access and crawl local file system content with security descriptors and return search results based on the user’s authorization level.
item.itunes:summary: This lab teaches how to use connectors in SharePoint Server 2013 to access and search across external data sources. Starting with a simple example using SharePoint Designer, the participant moves on to explore and implement a custom BCS connector in Microsoft Visual Studio. The connector shows how to access and crawl local file system content with security descriptors and return search results based on the user’s authorization level.

item.title: Introduction to Windows PowerShell with Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: SharePoint Server 2013 Preview includes native support for Windows PowerShell 3.0 to help IT get more done in less time. Windows PowerShell 3.0 provides a comprehensive management platform for all aspects of the data center: servers, network, and storage. In this newest version of Windows PowerShell, sessions to remote servers are more resilient and can withstand various types of interruptions. This lab introduces you to Windows PowerShell in SharePoint 2013.
item.itunes:summary: SharePoint Server 2013 Preview includes native support for Windows PowerShell 3.0 to help IT get more done in less time. Windows PowerShell 3.0 provides a comprehensive management platform for all aspects of the data center: servers, network, and storage. In this newest version of Windows PowerShell, sessions to remote servers are more resilient and can withstand various types of interruptions. This lab introduces you to Windows PowerShell in SharePoint 2013.

item.title: Introduction to the Machine Translation Service in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: You can reach more people with new cloud-based translation services capable of translating not only sites, but also their content. These services have a comprehensive set of APIs, REST, and CSOM support, so content can be pretranslated when needed, or translated on the fly by users' asynchronously, synchronously, or streaming. This lab introduces you to creating, configuring, and managing the Machine Translation Service in SharePoint Server 2013.
item.itunes:summary: You can reach more people with new cloud-based translation services capable of translating not only sites, but also their content. These services have a comprehensive set of APIs, REST, and CSOM support, so content can be pretranslated when needed, or translated on the fly by users' asynchronously, synchronously, or streaming. This lab introduces you to creating, configuring, and managing the Machine Translation Service in SharePoint Server 2013.

item.title: Introduction to Tenant Administration in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: SharePoint Server 2013 has been designed, developed, and tested with the Microsoft Software as a Service (SaaS) strategy at its core. Drawing extensively from that experience, SharePoint Server 2013 Preview offers you new and improved, highly flexible deployment options. This lab introduces you to Tenant Administration in SharePoint Server 2013.
item.itunes:summary: SharePoint Server 2013 has been designed, developed, and tested with the Microsoft Software as a Service (SaaS) strategy at its core. Drawing extensively from that experience, SharePoint Server 2013 Preview offers you new and improved, highly flexible deployment options. This lab introduces you to Tenant Administration in SharePoint Server 2013.

item.title: Hands-on with the Content Search Web Part in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this lab, participants gain hands-on experience with the new content search web part, and learn how it can harness the power of search to deliver adaptive experiences for end users.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, participants gain hands-on experience with the new content search web part, and learn how it can harness the power of search to deliver adaptive experiences for end users.

item.title: Exploring Search Query Rules in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab teaches how to configure and use query rules to modify search results. Specifically, participants open an out-of-the-box query rule, explore its settings, and modify it to show how search results are affected. Next, they learn how to create a query rule to promote customized results based on the user’s interests, skills, or other metadata in their profile.
item.itunes:summary: This lab teaches how to configure and use query rules to modify search results. Specifically, participants open an out-of-the-box query rule, explore its settings, and modify it to show how search results are affected. Next, they learn how to create a query rule to promote customized results based on the user’s interests, skills, or other metadata in their profile.

item.title: Embed a Data Connected Microsoft Visio Diagram in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this lab, learn to configure an existing Visio diagram to retrieve data from a SharePoint list. Learn to connect Visio shapes to the list data, and use a custom data graphic template to present the data on the shapes visually using text overlays, data bars, and fill colors. Then publish the diagram to SharePoint, and surface it on a Web Part page using the Visio Web Access Web Part. Using Web Part connections, add interactivity to the page. Configure and test automatic data refresh. Finally, explore collaboration features in Visio Services by adding comments to the diagram. This data driven Visio experience will be created without the need to write any programming code or database queries.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, learn to configure an existing Visio diagram to retrieve data from a SharePoint list. Learn to connect Visio shapes to the list data, and use a custom data graphic template to present the data on the shapes visually using text overlays, data bars, and fill colors. Then publish the diagram to SharePoint, and surface it on a Web Part page using the Visio Web Access Web Part. Using Web Part connections, add interactivity to the page. Configure and test automatic data refresh. Finally, explore collaboration features in Visio Services by adding comments to the diagram. This data driven Visio experience will be created without the need to write any programming code or database queries.

item.title: Creating a Data-Connected Dashboard Using Visio Services
item.description: In this lab, learn how to connect shapes in a Visio diagram to an external data source, publish the diagram to SharePoint, and configure as a web part page for the basis of a dashboard. Then extend the capabilities of the dashboard by adding custom HTML and JavaScript content that communicates with the Visio Services client side object model in order to add more dynamic capabilities and user interactivity.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, learn how to connect shapes in a Visio diagram to an external data source, publish the diagram to SharePoint, and configure as a web part page for the basis of a dashboard. Then extend the capabilities of the dashboard by adding custom HTML and JavaScript content that communicates with the Visio Services client side object model in order to add more dynamic capabilities and user interactivity.

item.title: Designing a Microsoft SharePoint 2013 Site
item.description: In this lab, participants gain first-hand experience transforming HTML mockups from a design agency into a great looking and fully functioning SharePoint 2013 site.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, participants gain first-hand experience transforming HTML mockups from a design agency into a great looking and fully functioning SharePoint 2013 site.

item.title: Deferred Site Collection Upgrade in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: A completely revised, backward-compatible upgrade experience is designed to balance the needs of users with those of IT. Because changing software is often difficult, SharePoint Server 2013 Preview enables IT to upgrade SharePoint Server 2010 without having to upgrade users' sites and content. These upgrades are deferred to the users, allowing them to choose when the time is right. This lab guides you through performing Deferred Site Collection Upgrades in SharePoint 2013.
item.itunes:summary: A completely revised, backward-compatible upgrade experience is designed to balance the needs of users with those of IT. Because changing software is often difficult, SharePoint Server 2013 Preview enables IT to upgrade SharePoint Server 2010 without having to upgrade users' sites and content. These upgrades are deferred to the users, allowing them to choose when the time is right. This lab guides you through performing Deferred Site Collection Upgrades in SharePoint 2013.

item.title: Create a Microsoft Excel BI Report and Share on Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this lab, explore the many new business intelligence features of Excel and SharePoint 2013. You create and enhance parameterized Excel PivotTable based reports that consume data from PowerPivot, with a high level overview of the data model behind the PowerPivot data model. You enhance the report by applying conditional formatting and adding a Timeline Slicer to filter data. You also use the new Quick Explore feature to add relevant visualizations to the workbook. You then publish the workbook to SharePoint and create a dashboard using components from the workbook. Using connected Web Parts and parameters, you provide user interactivity to the dashboard. You also leverage built-in features of Microsoft Excel Services 2013 like Fields List and Quick Analysis to manipulate the structure of the published report directly in the browser. "
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, explore the many new business intelligence features of Excel and SharePoint 2013. You create and enhance parameterized Excel PivotTable based reports that consume data from PowerPivot, with a high level overview of the data model behind the PowerPivot data model. item.title: Configuring User License Enforcement in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: Blended CAL deployments enable an organization to assign, manage, and track how licenses are used by their users and control access to features and capabilities. This lab introduces you to the concepts of configuring and using User License Enforcement in SharePoint 2013.
item.itunes:summary: Blended CAL deployments enable an organization to assign, manage, and track how licenses are used by their users and control access to features and capabilities. This lab introduces you to the concepts of configuring and using User License Enforcement in SharePoint 2013.

item.title: Business Connectivity Services (BCS) for Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this lab, create an External List from an OData source, create an External List in a SharePoint App from an ECT that is deployed with the App, create an External List from a Microsoft SQL Server database source and set up an alert, and create a service that receives notifications from External Systems when data changes occur and stores those notifications in a SharePoint list.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, create an External List from an OData source, create an External List in a SharePoint App from an ECT that is deployed with the App, create an External List from a Microsoft SQL Server database source and set up an alert, and create a service that receives notifications from External Systems when data changes occur and stores those notifications in a SharePoint list.

item.title: Building Windows 8 Apps with Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab focuses on building a Windows 8 solution that interacts with a SharePoint list.
item.itunes:summary: This lab focuses on building a Windows 8 solution that interacts with a SharePoint list.

item.title: Building Visual Studio-Based Workflows in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this exercise. create a workflow using Microsoft Visual Studio. This workflow will use the new HTTP and DynamicValue activities to issue a call from a sandbox solution deployed workflow that gets a description of a specified category from a publically available OData service.
item.itunes:summary: In this exercise. create a workflow using Microsoft Visual Studio. This workflow will use the new HTTP and DynamicValue activities to issue a call from a sandbox solution deployed workflow that gets a description of a specified category from a publically available OData service.

item.title: Building Task Pane Apps for Microsoft Office 2013
item.description: In this lab, build a task pane application for Microsoft Excel that will read, write, and respond to user interaction with a spreadsheet.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, build a task pane application for Microsoft Excel that will read, write, and respond to user interaction with a spreadsheet.

item.title: Building SharePoint-Hosted Apps with "Napa"
item.description: This lab introduces you to the new online development environment for Microsoft Office 365, called "Napa." Build both a Microsoft SharePoint and a Microsoft Office client solution.
item.itunes:summary: This lab introduces you to the new online development environment for Microsoft Office 365, called "Napa." Build both a Microsoft SharePoint and a Microsoft Office client solution.

item.title: Building SharePoint Designer-Based Workflows in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this lab, you create a simple workflow that updates a SharePoint list item. The workflow will be created using Microsoft SharePoint Designer 2013.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, you create a simple workflow that updates a SharePoint list item. The workflow will be created using Microsoft SharePoint Designer 2013.

item.title: Building Custom Forms for Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab walks through the basics of creating a SharePoint hosted solution, including creating a custom form for entering data into a list.
item.itunes:summary: This lab walks through the basics of creating a SharePoint hosted solution, including creating a custom form for entering data into a list.

item.title: Building Content Apps for Microsoft Office 2013
item.description: In this lab you build a content application that will sit on the surface of a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet. It will read, write, and respond to user interaction within the spreadsheet.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab you build a content application that will sit on the surface of a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet. It will read, write, and respond to user interaction within the spreadsheet.

item.title: Building an Auto-Hosted App
item.description: This lab walks through the basics of building an auto-hosted solution for Microsoft Office 365 using Microsoft Visual Studio 2011.
item.itunes:summary: This lab walks through the basics of building an auto-hosted solution for Microsoft Office 365 using Microsoft Visual Studio 2011.

item.title: Building a Product Centric Site in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab takes you through the process of building a product-oriented site using the new features of SharePoint 2013, including the product catalog, managed navigation, the content search web part, and faceted navigation and refinement.
item.itunes:summary: This lab takes you through the process of building a product-oriented site using the new features of SharePoint 2013, including the product catalog, managed navigation, the content search web part, and faceted navigation and refinement.

item.title: What's New with the Project Portfolio Management (PPM) Solution from Microsoft
item.description: Regardless if you are a Microsoft SharePoint guru exploring advanced workloads that will help you justify the value of ECal or part of the Project Field Family (people who sell, support and deploy Project), don’t miss the opportunity to walk through Microsoft Project Server 2013 that is built on top of SharePoint Server 2013! This lab provides end-to-end Project lifecycle walkthrough, from initiation, through selection, planning, time reporting to completion. The lab gives hands-on experience with the *new* Project Portfolio Management (PPM) capabilities – in the demand management area – especially workflows, business intelligence and integration with the broader Microsoft platform! This lab is available as Hand-on Lab and Instructor-led Lab where skilled instructor will walk you through this topic!"

item.title: What's New in Microsoft Project Professional 2013 and Sync to Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab has been very popular among Project Managers as well as the Project Field Family (people who sell, support and deploy Project). Don’t miss the opportunity to walk through the new Project and learn about the functionality that can help you every day! This lab highlights the key investments in Project Professional 2013 and Project Pro for Microsoft Office 365 and the new capabilities of building the schedule in a SharePoint list and seamlessly connecting the two, giving the Project Manager instant insight through the new reporting and additional tools to successfully manage the project, schedule and resources. This lab is available as a Hand-on Lab and Instructor-led Lab where skilled instructor will walk you through this topic!

item.title: People Search in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: This lab gives you an understanding of the new features in People Search with SharePoint Server 2013.
item.itunes:summary: This lab gives you an understanding of the new features in People Search with SharePoint Server 2013.

item.title: Introduction to Search in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab provides an end-to-end tour of the new Search experience, starting with indexing a basic content source, then showing basic content processing configuration, configuring a query rule, and making a minor update to the end user experience.
item.itunes:summary: This lab provides an end-to-end tour of the new Search experience, starting with indexing a basic content source, then showing basic content processing configuration, configuring a query rule, and making a minor update to the end user experience.

item.title: Introduction to Backup and Restore in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: Data loss is non-negotiable. The ability to retrieve lost data is critical to availability and compliance. This lab introduces you to the backup and restore capabilities in SharePoint 2013.
item.itunes:summary: Data loss is non-negotiable. The ability to retrieve lost data is critical to availability and compliance. This lab introduces you to the backup and restore capabilities in SharePoint 2013.

item.title: Introduction to Web Content Management in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this lab, learn about some of the core new concepts for Web Content Management in SharePoint 2013. You export rich formatted text content from Microsoft Word into a SharePoint publishing page. You publish video and image assets in SharePoint using renditions. You then use the new translations and variations features in SharePoint 2013 to see automatic localization of the published content.
item.itunes:summary: In this lab, learn about some of the core new concepts for Web Content Management in SharePoint 2013. You export rich formatted text content from Microsoft Word into a SharePoint publishing page. You publish video and image assets in SharePoint using renditions. You then use the new translations and variations features in SharePoint 2013 to see automatic localization of the published content.

item.title: Information Management in Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013
item.description: SharePoint Server 2013 Preview extends compliance beyond just content. Improvements in Information Management Policies are designed to provide balance between enabling user self-service and ensuring content adheres to corporate policy: IT professionals can define corporate-wide Information Management Policies and apply them to site collections as they are created. This lab guides you through enabling and applying Site Policies in SharePoint Server 2013.

Improvements in Information Management Policies are designed to provide balance between enabling user self-service and ensuring content adheres to corporate policy: IT professionals can define corporate-wide Information Management Policies and apply them to site collections as they are created. This lab guides you through enabling and applying Site Policies in SharePoint Server 2013.

item.title: Extending the Search Experience in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab shows how to extend and build on the Search User Experience, including the use of templates to change the way the results are laid out and how each result looks.
item.itunes:summary: This lab shows how to extend and build on the Search User Experience, including the use of templates to change the way the results are laid out and how each result looks.

item.title: Exploring Social Features in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: Explore the new social features in SharePoint 2013. In this lab, learn how to follow sites, documents, and people, leverage the newsfeed, and review the new community and project site templates.
item.itunes:summary: Explore the new social features in SharePoint 2013. In this lab, learn how to follow sites, documents, and people, leverage the newsfeed, and review the new community and project site templates.

item.title: Database Snapshots with Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: Database snapshots provide a read-only, static view of a source database as it existed at snapshot creation. Snapshots can be used for reporting purposes, and in the event of a user error on a source database, you can revert the source database to the state it was in when the snapshot was created. Data loss is confined to updates to the database since the snapshot's creation. Also, creating a database snapshot can be useful immediately before making a major change to a database, such as changing the schema or the structure of a table. This lab introduces you to using Database Snapshots with SharePoint 2013.

Snapshots can be used for reporting purposes, and in the event of a user error on a source database, you can revert the source database to the state it was in when the snapshot was created. Data loss is confined to updates to the database since the snapshot's creation. Also, creating a database snapshot can be useful immediately before making a major change to a database, such as changing the schema or the structure of a table. This lab introduces you to using Database Snapshots with SharePoint 2013.

item.title: Creating a SharePoint App with Microsoft Access Services
item.description: The new Microsoft Access has all the tools needed to get data-centric applications up and running quickly on Microsoft SharePoint in a professional new application interface without any development knowledge required. See how Access hides the normal complexities of creating a relational database (i.e., rules, schema, views) by having you just input what you would like to track and then launch a SQL-backed app on SharePoint. Users are able to view and manipulate the data in a completed device tracking app for SharePoint within a few minutes. You then build this same tracking app from scratch using Access 2013 with Access Services. Once complete, you will see your app running in a browser and be able to share it. "

item.title: Configuring Social Features in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This lab is an extension of the user-oriented “Exploring Social Features in Microsoft SharePoint 2013” and focuses on configuration of social features in SharePoint 2013. Learn how to share newsfeed activities, modify settings for email notifications related to social activities, edit other profile details, configure a community site, and enable site feeds.

Learn how to share newsfeed activities, modify settings for email notifications related to social activities, edit other profile details, configure a community site, and enable site feeds.

item.title: Configuring Office Web Applications for Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: Office Web Apps has evolved into a separate server product, Microsoft Office Web Apps Server, that can serve multiple SharePoint farms for viewing and editing documents. In addition, a server or farm that runs Office Web Apps can be used to view files that are stored across data stores. This lab introduces the concepts required to establish connectivity between the Office Web Apps and SharePoint 2013.

In addition, a server or farm that runs Office Web Apps can be used to view files that are stored across data stores. item.title: Administering the New Microsoft SharePoint Online
item.description: This lab walks you through the new SharePoint Online admin center. During the lab, learn how to create and apply permissions to site collections, enable external sharing, and manage user profiles.
item.itunes:summary: This lab walks you through the new SharePoint Online admin center. During the lab, learn how to create and apply permissions to site collections, enable external sharing, and manage user profiles.

item.title: Tips You Need to Know for Creating Apps for Microsoft Office and SharePoint 2013
item.description: In this session, we cover some tools and techniques for building out apps for Microsoft Office and SharePoint, including architecting for cross-domain scenarios, types of apps and much, much more. This is a must attend session for all app for Office and SharePoint developers.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, we cover some tools and techniques for building out apps for Microsoft Office and SharePoint, including architecting for cross-domain scenarios, types of apps and much, much more. This is a must attend session for all app for Office and SharePoint developers.

item.title: Microsoft IT’s Practical Guide on Migrating to the Cloud
item.description: In this session, you are introduced to how Microsoft is moving its core business functions to the cloud. Microsoft IT Subject-Matter-Experts discuss the internal efforts at Microsoft with the objective of sharing critical lessons learned in our journey in the cloud, with emphasis on the following: 1) Our strategic vision and roadmap. 2) The organizational, business, and cultural hurdles we face; and the steps we are taking to overcome those hurdles while providing critical business support to our 189,000 internal users across 100+ countries globally. 3) Real-world case studies highlighting key architectural decisions we implemented as we moved our application portfolio to Windows Azure, and implement Microsoft Office 365, including SharePoint Online. 4) The inherent benefits we have reaped thus far, lessons learned, and recommended best practices from our efforts to date. After attending this session, you'll walk away with an understanding of the Microsoft vision and roadmap for moving to the cloud, the approaches we have taken to secure broad commitment, how we have overcome business and technical challenges, and our key lessons learned.

item.title: Understanding the Fundamentals of SharePoint Claims-Based Authentication
item.description: This is an introductory session that provides you with a foundation to understand the main components of the claims model and how these components work together in a SharePoint environment. An overview of the high level configuration steps of a claims provider (ADFS) are discussed, and some of the most common gotchas of configuring claims-based authentication are covered. This session also summarizes the authentication, authorization, and security changes from Microsoft SharePoint 2010 to SharePoint 2013.
item.itunes:summary: This is an introductory session that provides you with a foundation to understand the main components of the claims model and how these components work together in a SharePoint environment. An overview of the high level configuration steps of a claims provider (ADFS) are discussed, and some of the most common gotchas of configuring claims-based authentication are covered. item.title: The Only Way to Go Is Up! Upgrade to Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: Think you know the upgrade story? SharePoint 2013 may add powerful capabilities for information workers. But SharePoint 2010 is a much larger and more complex system to upgrade than its predecessors, and Microsoft has added new tools and removed some longstanding techniques used in prior upgrades. Based on dozens of upgrades and months of practice with SharePoint 2013, we show you how to plan, execute, and manage an upgraded SharePoint 2013 environment, with plenty of live demos along the way.
item.itunes:summary: Think you know the upgrade story? SharePoint 2013 may add powerful capabilities for information workers. But SharePoint 2010 is a much larger and more complex system to upgrade than its predecessors, and Microsoft has added new tools and removed some longstanding techniques used in prior upgrades. Based on dozens of upgrades and months of practice with SharePoint 2013, we show you how to plan, execute, and manage an upgraded SharePoint 2013 environment, with plenty of live demos along the way.

item.description: Coming Soon.

item.title: Search Architecture, Sizing, and Migration in Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: Successful SharePoint deployments have one thing in common: great search! Do you want to know what's powering the greatest search experience SharePoint has delivered to date? In this session we take you under the hood and explain the architecture. We take a close look at the feeding chain, the core search engine, query execution and the new analytics and recommendation engine as-well as sizing and migration scenarios. You will leave the session with a better understanding of the architecture and some practical tips and tricks that will help you in your work with search.

item.title: Real SharePoint Apps, Real Fast with the New Microsoft Access 2013
item.description: Come see how Microsoft Access 2013 and Access Services 2013 will let anyone build SharePoint Apps backed by SQL Azure in just about 60 seconds. In this session, learn how to create, share, and collaborate in an IT managed environment. Office 365 provides everything you need to enable end-users to create high-value, "no code", collaborative business apps. The new Access 2013 allows you to satisfy the need for agile development from your business units and still rest assured that the data is secured, backed up, and managed appropriately. Also, hear about how legacy Access applications within your organization can be brought forward to the web on SharePoint.

item.title: Microsoft SharePoint 2013 Sharing and Security
item.description: SharePoint 2013 introduces new sharing features that make it easier than ever for end users, with appropriate permissions, to share content with internal and (in Microsoft Office 365) external users. It’s more important than ever that you master the SharePoint security model, with its deep hierarchy of securable objects, granular permissions and policies, and interconnected user interfaces. This session demystifies SharePoint security by dissecting each of these components and presenting best practices for implementing and managing security. Learn how to effectively assign least privilege permissions. Discover under-documented “gotchas” of broken inheritance. Take away options for new permission levels and settings that address common business requirements. And learn when and why it makes sense to leverage Active Directory groups or use SharePoint groups.

item.dc:creator: Dan Holme

item.title: Developing Apps for Microsoft SharePoint 2013 with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012
item.description: Want to know how to best take advantage of Visual Studio to develop apps for SharePoint? In this demo-heavy session we explore SharePoint development tools which extend Visual Studio 2012. See our first-class support for common app features including client web parts, remote event receivers, Workflows and more. Learn how to develop apps locally or using a Microsoft Office 365 Developer Site. See how ALM capabilities available in Visual Studio Ultimate and Team Foundation Server can be applied when working with SharePoint 2013.

item.title: Developing Advanced BI Visualizations with Microsoft Visio and SharePoint in the Cloud
item.description: In this session, learn how to create a BI heat map in the cloud using Visio Services, Business Connectivity Services, and Microsoft SQL Azure all within Microsoft SharePoint Online in Microsoft Office 365. Key topics include: New data connectivity options for Visio and Visio Services; New rendering capabilities for Visio Services; Bonus: Using the Visio API to generate data connected diagrams published to Visio Services.

item.title: Deliver Adaptive and Personalized Experiences with Microsoft SharePoint 2013
item.description: This session offers an overview of the new features for building websites on SharePoint 2013, both for Internet and Intranet use. This is a big release for SharePoint in this space, offering deep integration between Search and Content Management, and new features in site design, authoring, presentation, content reuse, metadata driven navigation, and adaptive experiences.
item.itunes:summary: This session offers an overview of the new features for building websites on SharePoint 2013, both for Internet and Intranet use. This is a big release for SharePoint in this space, offering deep integration between Search and Content Management, and new features in site design, authoring, presentation, content reuse, metadata driven navigation, and adaptive experiences.
item.dc:creator: Cem Aykan, Frank Danielsen (FAST)

item.title: Building End-to-End Apps for Microsoft SharePoint with Windows Azure and Windows 8
item.description: With the deep SharePoint 2013 API set, coupled with the new app models for SharePoint and Microsoft Office, the opportunity to build innovative end-to-end solutions that span cloud services and devices is just plain breathtaking. SharePoint data is available via REST and SharePoint can fire events to light up your backend services—like sending notifications via the Windows Push Notification Service to SharePoint workflows. And all your cloud-based services can be powered by the reliability, scalability, and elasticity of Windows Azure, from websites to SQL databases. In this session an end-to-end demo is the backdrop for the discussion around the architecture and code needed to build just such a solution.

SharePoint data is available via REST and SharePoint can fire events to light up your backend services—like sending notifications via the Windows Push Notification Service to SharePoint workflows. And all your cloud-based services can be powered by the reliability, scalability, and elasticity of Windows Azure, from websites to SQL databases. item.dc:creator: Donovan Follette

item.title: Advanced Patterns in Cloud-Hosted Apps for Microsoft SharePoint
item.description: This session provides a deep-dive into the advanced design patterns and practices for developing real-world cloud-hosted apps for SharePoint. Attendees follow a Help Desk application from inception and development to publishing in the marketplace and deployment throughout an organization. Learn about tenancy, trials, and other unique considerations for provider-hosted apps in this interactive session.

Learn about tenancy, trials, and other unique considerations for provider-hosted apps in this interactive session.
item.dc:creator: Richard diZerega, Nathan Miller

item.title: What's Your Social IQ? Succeeding with SharePoint Social
item.description: For years, Microsoft SharePoint has promised smoother collaboration using “social” technology – MySites, metadata, newsfeeds. But user satisfaction with social has trailed traditional document collaboration. Join us for an overview of how to establish SharePoint social technology (2010 and 2013) – from both a technology and cultural perspective. See best case, real-world scenarios for how to use social in effective distributed collaboration, and why! Learn about measuring overall enterprise social maturity levels, and setting up specific tactical operation business intelligence (real usage data) to identify successes and problems in SharePoint 2010 and 2013 social. This session also explores the decision to extend: what the major third-party social vendors bring to the table.
item.itunes:summary: For years, Microsoft SharePoint has promised smoother collaboration using “social” technology – MySites, metadata, newsfeeds. But user satisfaction with social has trailed traditional document collaboration. Join us for an overview of how to establish SharePoint social technology (2010 and 2013) – from both a technology and cultural perspective. See best case, real-world scenarios for how to use social in effective distributed collaboration, and why! Learn about measuring overall enterprise social maturity levels, and setting up specific tactical operation business intelligence (real usage data) to identify successes and problems in SharePoint 2010 and 2013 social. This session also explores the decision to extend: what the major third-party social vendors bring to the table.
item.dc:creator: Chris McNulty

item.title: Enterprise Social Network Scared Straight: Learn By Doing
item.description: Companies of all shapes and sizes are still trying to make sense of enterprise social networking. Regardless of where you're at in your journey, there will be pitfalls along the way. Steve and Allison have been through the trenches as former customers embarking upon this space. Come for an interactive demonstration and hear about their experiences as customers and how they are now working with Microsoft customers to transform the way people work.
item.itunes:summary: Companies of all shapes and sizes are still trying to make sense of enterprise social networking. Regardless of where you're at in your journey, there will be pitfalls along the way. Steve and Allison have been through the trenches as former customers embarking upon this space. item.dc:creator: Allison Michels, Steve Nguyen

item.title: Overview of Enterprise Social from Microsoft
item.description: Enterprise Social is enabling organizations to transform their businesses, to harnesses the power of their most valuable asset, their people, by connecting employees, partners, and customers. Microsoft has made significant investments in Enterprise Social in Office 365, SharePoint 2013 and with the acquisition of Yammer. In this session we cover our vision and roadmap for this transformative technology, in addition to highlighting the significant opportunity for business value using case studies and demonstrations.
item.itunes:summary: Enterprise Social is enabling organizations to transform their businesses, to harnesses the power of their most valuable asset, their people, by connecting employees, partners, and customers. Microsoft has made significant investments in Enterprise Social in Office 365, SharePoint 2013 and with the acquisition of Yammer. In this session we cover our vision and roadmap for this transformative technology, in addition to highlighting the significant opportunity for business value using case studies and demonstrations.
item.dc:creator: Christophe Fiessinger, David Cohen

item.title: Overview of eDiscovery across the Microsoft Office Platform
item.description: eDiscovery is a major area of investment in the new version of Office. With the new release, we've built the ability into the platform (across Microsoft Exchange, SharePoint, and Lync) to perform the discovery process in-place, on-premises or in the cloud. In this session, come learn about the centralized eDiscovery tools we have delivered to unify the identification, preservation, and export process for content to make it extremely easy for legal teams to do their work without affecting end user productivity. Also learn about the substantial cost savings through the reduction of third-party tools and reduction of storage needs by holding content across Exchange, SharePoint, and Lync in-place.
item.itunes:summary: eDiscovery is a major area of investment in the new version of Office. With the new release, we've built the ability into the platform (across Microsoft Exchange, SharePoint, and Lync) to perform the discovery process in-place, on-premises or in the cloud. In this session, come learn about the centralized eDiscovery tools we have delivered to unify the identification, preservation, and export process for content to make it extremely easy for legal teams to do their work without affecting end user productivity. item.dc:creator: Georgiana Badea

item.title: Microsoft SharePoint 2013 and Office 365 Upgrade and Migration: Strategy and Tactics
item.description: SharePoint 2013 and Microsoft Office 365 offer “big wins” for business value and service delivery. But which features and capabilities are the most compelling reasons to move, and how and when should you upgrade or migrate? In this session, SharePoint MVP shares what he’s learned from customers around the world, and provides guidance for your strategy, roadmap, and tactical approach to integrating these new versions into your SharePoint service. Learn what’s changed about the technical aspects of upgrading—most importantly, the impact of 2010 mode and deferred site upgrades. Explore the factors that should drive your upgrade and migration planning. And learn how to drive towards the optimal mix of cloud and on-premise SharePoint service for your enterprise.

item.dc:creator: Dan Holme

Throughout this session, we walk through code that demonstrates how apps for SharePoint work.

item.title: Configuring Microsoft Exchange Protection and Control
item.description: During this lab, create new data loss prevention (DLP) policies, and then test the functionality of the DLP policies. After completing the exercises, you will be able to: Create a new DLP policy using Windows PowerShell, create a new DLP policy from a template, create and modify DLP policy rules, test incident reporting, and work with Policy Tips in Microsoft Outlook 2013.
